We had a lovely view of the gardens and the room was lovely too
They were very welcoming & friendly during our stay.
Rooms & bathrooms were huge as seen in pictures. Great place to put everyone together with so much space.
However, it's sort of too close to "nature"?

There were plenty of mosquitoes, insects, lizards etc. Had really bad insect bites on my legs. So, would have been better if they have plenty of mosquito coils all the time. The electronic version given in room didn't work at all!
Location wise, it's not in the heart of seminyak. Walking distance from warung made.
0.title: “Huge rooms, private pool but too near to nature!”

description: We had just spent ten days at a big resort and needed an extra 5 nights of accommodation due to cancelled flights. We were absolutely delighted from the moment we stepped inside. After the resort (which was also lovely), it felt great to have lots of space and much more privacy. The rooms are huge, everything was clean and comfortable. Although a hundred metres from the main street in Seminyak, all I could hear while lying by the pool were roosters crowing and the breeze in the palm trees. I would stay here again.
Stayed at this boutique villa for 3 nights. The location is superb - it is quiet yet just 100 meters from the main street and 10 minutes walk from the beach.
The staff are friendly. Room is spacious but the interior is a little out dated and worn (particularly in the bathroom).

The private pool is of good size and the water is clean - you can actually swim in there. Buffet Breakfast is so-so, but for a boutique villa with less than 20 units (correct me if I am wrong) I will give it a pass. I was suprised when I ordered in villa breakfast - the staff actually cook the eggs in your villa and it took like forever (the cooking and washing)! The intention is good but for us we prefer a ready made breakfast be set up in a minute.
We had problems with the WiFi but eventually sorted it out so I assume the WiFi problem can be fixed.
Overall we had a pleasant stay.

Fantastic holiday enjoyed by all, awesome villas and staff so friendly and will do anything to help you. The villas were so clean and comfortable, very relaxing. Thank you to all the staff from our cleaners, the pool man Roy and the beautiful staff in reception you all made our holiday AWESOME.

We stayed at this villa in June, 2015.and I must say it was pure luxury. We were two couples and opted for 2 room villa with private swimming pool. The villa had a nice small kitchen with dining table and a sitting. The rooms were quite spacious but it were the bathrooms which took the cake. The bathrooms had a huge tub and a separate shower area with an air-conditioner. The villa lobby also had a music system to unwind in the evening.

The Hotel is situated bang in the market of seminyak and 10 minutes walk to the beach.The Manager Edde was quite friendly and remembered us with our first names. The girls at the reception were also friendly. Although to avail spa they take you to another property.The breakfast was a bit of a let down with limited spread.
Cons: Wifi did not work for the entire 3 days of the stay.

We recently stated for 3 nights with 2 adults & 2 children, villa was nice kids thought they were in paradise, great spot just off main rd & handy to Double six beach, all the staff were amazing especially Rini who always remembered our names &'made us feel so welcome.
5.title: “Quiet & private”

description: We stay at two bedrooms suite, and we have a huge private pool with huge bathroom. Feel like didn't want to leave the hotel but we need to walk around and enjoy the beauty of Bali island!
It's central location did really help us to navigate around Seminyak!
We had a lovely relaxing week at the villa, private quiet tucked away however the shopping strip and restaurants in Seminyak was only a 5 minute walk.
The staff are very helpful, we enjoyed the breakfast every morning.
Would thoroughly recommend the villa as a place to stay.

Amazing luxury villas, great pool and very clean. Service was first class. Nice walk to shops and restaurants. Would highly recommend for those who want privacy but access to things to do outside of the villa lifestyle.

Nice place to stay with friends or family. Large bedrooms (we stayed at 2 bedrooms villa), spacious living room with stereo set overlooking the pool, huge bathroom with extremely hot water (yes, I said "extreme" because even when I turned on the cold water switch, the water came out hot (it was HOT, not warm) which is the way I like). The pool water was warm all the time so we could swim anytime we wanted. The villa is quiet, but located within downtown Seminyak and close to cool hangout places like Potato Head. The employees are super friendly and helpful!!

The downsides are: 1) the air-conditions in every bedroom was not cool enough even when it was set to the lowest temp, 2) the breakfast was so-so, 3) there were some animals (rats or birds) wandering around in the open living room at night time while we were asleep. On our first morning, we found cakes and cookies (that we put on the dining table the night before) scattered on the floor. The second morning, we found broken glasses on the floor.
But overall, it's a nice place to stay and recommended.
- Ima -

Our stay was lovely, a few minor things like our doorbell rang constantly everyday for a few hours, the buffet breakfast we paid for wasn't set up every day because the villas where not at full capacity, which is silly because we paid for it...And the shower was dribble, but other then that the villa was amazing and I would recommend my friends to stay!
10.title: “It was beautiful but not perfect.”

description: From moment walk through the door it feels like own personal paradise. This is our third time staying here as a family of 5. Staff are great rooms amazingly clean. Great location easy walk to beach shops and restaurants. Could not recommend more highly for a relaxing family holiday location.

These Villas are large and lovely, also private. There off the main road just down a little alley way. There a 2 minute walk to Bingtang supermarket, cross the road from the BMC money exchange. 5 min taxi to Seminyak Square where some of the best restaurants are. Cross the road from Sip French Restaurant and next door to Panterai Greek restaurant. Breakfast is upstairs in the restaurant. Room service available. Little outside cocktail area. Biggest bathroom. 10 minute walk down Double 6 to the beach. Great location. Central. The most helpful and friendly staff. Sad to have left. Thanks to Suraya, Artha and the girls at the front desk, the kitchen staff and all house keeping staff. Would definitely stay again.

My hubby and I were initially booked our accomodation with the Crown Astana Villas in seminyak where we were very dissapointed with their description of the villas, their services and advertised amenities that where grossly exaggerated and after spending our first 2 nights in a villa with a broken air conditioner, my hubby wanted to take me to the seminyak suites (as he had stayed here previously) and ask if we can take a look at an empty villa so I could get to see the differance and as soon as I walked through that door and saw that huge outdoor sanctuary I knew there was no way I was going back to our tiny little sauna for the 4 nights we had left in Bali. When we asked the guys who showed us the villa that we would not get a refund from the other place, but we still wanted to stay here and could they try get us the best possible price we were so impressed with their efforts and numerous calls he made to the management that eventually rewarded us by almost halving their original price. From that moment on our holiday was transformed. From their amazing room service and housekeeping to the pampering spa experience I can honestly say I had the time of my life and will only ever stay here for every future visit to Bali aswell as advise anyone I know who is going to Bali to stay at the seminyak villa suites
Not sure where to start, just returned home after staying in a two bedroom privet villa (105) with its own privet pool.

We only stayed for 7 nights and wish it was another 7. From driveway entrance being greeted by the staff with a smile, the area was just so clean all the time, villa was cleaned everyday anything at request was completed straight away.

It happened to be my parents and my brother and wife's wedding anniversary two days apart. We had come back to the villa on both days with flowers in the room and rose peddles on the bed. My brothers bed had two swans made from like a towel. They also came in to the villa with a cake which was just sensational thank you to Putu and the staff.
We also had the buffet breakfast and when the facility wasn't setup in the privet villa location a buggy was organised to take you to location across the road.
Highly recommend the in house massage, the traditional Balinese massage is a must.
Will stay again with no hesitations
Thank you Putu, Artha and staff from The Seminyak Suite

My partner,his daughter and I went to bali at the end of January 2015, although we found this place after not having a good room at the haere , we were offered another place to stay and that ended up being the seminyak suite , there is just so much to say about this place , 5 stars all the way , the service was incredible, the staff go above and beyond with any request, they made u feel at home , the price is really good and the aircon in the rooms were good and having an outside ceiling fan was a good thing also , the pool was really nice and big for a 2 bedroom, the bathrooms are huge and also has an aircon in it too .the villas are very quiet and that's good the staff helped up book anything we needed at no extra cost , they also have wonderful buffet breakfast and u truly feel like royalty at these villas, they have a buggy that goes to and from the lagoon spa( u must go here it's beautiful) so they drop u off and pick u up at no extra charge , I mean who doesn't want to ride in the back of the buggy haha, they have great security also overall this place is a must we are going to bali in October and we will be staying here again , a big thanks to AYU for helping us find the perfect villa, and Gek, and rani/rini , sorry not sure how to say it ,
15.title: “Magical holiday”

description: Location: There are two types of Bali, the nature endowed beaches or countryside and there is the crowded city style places of Seminyak and Kuta. This villa is located in the heart of seminyak on the main road, so easily accessible to a lot of restaurants and shopping and spas. Seminyak beach is a 10 min walk away.

Stay: Villas are simply the best I have seen, with a very good pool and large rooms and even larger bathroom. Wifi works well, Housekeeping usually comes soon if you have to fix the pool or have any issues, spa is in their other property and not inhouse, room delivery is also served from another hotel which is away and hence takes more time than usual.
Service: Nothing to write back home about, service is as normal as it gets (neither good nor bad, but not overwhelming like hotels.
Best thing I liked: The bathroom size and amenities in the bathroom
What I didn't like: They made us wait for almost 2 - 3 hours for both our villas to get ready, inspite of reaching at the mentioned check in time.

We spent in Bali 8 days and we stayed in this villa. To our arrival we felt a very friendly and nice atmosphere. The villa was clean and confortable, we only suggest to bring your soap and your airdryer (if you have long hair, because the one in the villa is really small).

The position is strategic bacause the beach is close to the villa (15 min by foot) and on the main road you can find a lot of restaurants, shops, markets and everything you need. The breakfast was ok, every two days you can find different foodstuffs; the only downside, in our opinion, is that the juices were not made from fresh fruits.
We recommend to visit the volcano and rice fields!
This was our first time here and we loved it.ithe villa are huge with private swimming pool,make it nice place to stay and spent your day.
We use the three bedroom villas.the room is big,clean and very comfort,the bathroom are huge,with a big bathtub and shower and also air conditioner in it, also the staffs are very helpful.
The location is at seminyak,near to kuta and legian,and many restaurant and shopping place.
The food is great,simple but delicious.
We were stayed at villa 111 211 311 and wE Have problem with the rain.We have flood In out villa,please fix the draination.

Having just returned from Bali 2 days ago, I wanted to share our experience while still fresh. I would thoroughly reccomend staying here. As the other reviews have stated all the qualities the suites have to offer I will not dwell too much on this. The only downside if I can call it that is when we arrived our room was not as requested. ( we have two children and when booked assured us we would have two singles and 1 king bed.) We were moved the next day and all was good. We had two issues: one with the air conditioning and the other the toilet, both were fixed within the hour. We stayed in unit 104 and then 114 both were great. Breakfast was not Sheraton or Sofitel standard but hey you are in BALI and was substantial. (try the omelettes that they cook for you on demand or any type of egg you want cooked).

We went to Nusa dua one day and fell in love with it and ended up forfeiting our two last days here. The staff were very much worried that something had happened and after much reassurring that nothing was wrong they gave us a driver to Nusa Dua free of charge!
The staff are great and always have welcoming smiles when returning or when coming to breakfast.
I would like to especially thank Indra at reception for her help when leaving and Artha at breakfast on the last day.
All in all a great stay and a handy location but a BIG walk to the beach.
If you want to swim at any of the beaches this side of Bali I would not come in the rainy season as the beaches are full of rubbish.
We ended up booking these suites as a last minute trip organised before Christmas, and so glad we did. We only had 5 night here as it was booked out after that, but could have stayed 5 weeks.
The villas are HUGE. We had a 2 bedroom villa with a huge pool that would be about 3mx8m.
Each bedroom is basically a separate room on either side of an open living area beside the pool. There is a dining table, day bed, kitchen and sun chairs.

We had a minor issue with air-conditioning in one of the rooms, but this was fixed in 20 mins by their on site technicians. There is also 2 separate units in each room for both the bedroom and bathroom to keep it all cool.
Villas are cleaned every day unlike some others, and the pool was also scrubbed daily.

Only partial downside was the breakfast that was served in the restaurant. It was on the smaller and plane side, but as an inclusion in the price it was fine. We headed out for breakfast on a few days so no big deal.

The bathrooms are also huge with the biggest bath tub I have ever seen. It was so large we never used it as it would have taken about an hour to fill. Our entire family of 4 sat in it with room to spare just as a joke.

The location of the villas are great, but you are slightly further away from the main restaurant district of Seminyak if that is an issue of you. Taxis to that area cost around $3 so not to big of a deal.
The staff are incredibly friendly and our kids loved them. They really went the extra mile to make our stay wonderful.
20.title: “AMAZING slice of heaven”

description: This was our 3rd time back and we loved it . we were moved down from villa 3 to the one at the very end . we had friends with us and they absolutely loved the place , they feell in love with it the moment we arrived . Great service as usual , and the place is so clean. The staff also go out of there way to assist you whenever they can we will be back !

The seminyak suite is just away from main road...convenience for dining and shopping. The room is comfortable, privacy and clean, The most awesome is private pool with quite and relax place. The staff here is very helpful and Nice. We highly recommend to stay when you're in Bali.
Let's start with the great location that is a little hidden and not easy to find.
Check-in was late due to time taken to clean the room even about half an hour after check-in time at 3:30pm. The welcome drink is a refreshing start though: guava orange pineapple mix juice.
First impression of the private villa: WOW this is nice!

Starts with the outdoor family area and quite a good size private pool. Each room is a separate section with extremely large bathroom with rain shower, huge bath tub and an aircond (2 per room total).

Once we start using the place the issues begun. Useless wifi other than in the lobby, hairdryer that struggles to dry short men's hair (the ladies gave up altogether), 3 hours to fill up the huge bath tub and limited hot water making the bath tub more suitable for a cool dip.
Breakfast is not worth going if you prefer the good local food. If you got to pay extra (190K++) don't bother at all.
Lost room key cost USD250!!!
All in all it was nice to have a family size private villa near the shops and beach without being hassled by the bogans at Kuta. Enjoy the company at the pool and bring your own hairdryer.

Returned from Bali just and on the way home and feel obliged to warn others that this is not a villa to enter if you are looking for an acceptable level of clenliness. Pretty much everything seemed filthy and tired. Staff were a mixed bunch, some were pretty dull lacking in helpfulness and others pleasant enough as what one would expect. Definitely not what I would rate a 4.5 star anything.

Like others wrote, beds not great and mosquitos are plentiful in and out of the rooms. You also spend half the stay logingin and re-logingin into the wifi network pretty much everytime you need to use it. Name and room number drilled into your head each time you type it in the tiny login screen.

Citing some examples of further frustration, on arrival in the evening @ 7 or so, strait away front desk wished to collect remaining payment ontop of the one nights deposit already given. No real chance to settle down but I wonder if they were concerned after the first night if we hadn't paid whether we'd bugger off someplace else.

On our arrival to villa, we had to call for help with fixing the airconditiong which after the helper came to look at it still never really worked properly the whole stay. Get the overwhelming feeling no one cares to upkeep. Noticed quite a lot of bird crap around and on the deck chairs too to add to the filth.

What agitated us most was simply the extension till 6pm which we were charged half a days stay which we reluctantly paid as we were out and needed to take a dip and shower before flying in the evening. Returning as we did we were really disgusted to see that breakfast was left out all day without being cleaned up and it felt like an avery with birds everywhere leaving a right mess of the food and tons of poop and feathers in the pool. Seriously Seminyak SPV, get your act together.
Also the food, really needs attention too. Pancakes were the only thing I took away from this stay as a positive.
And going on replies to negative posts the the management reply to, sincerity like that of our stay seems extremely lacking.
Clean and comfortable.
Very disappointing breakfast served in communal restaurant unlike other villas where they will lay out the breakfast in your villa itself.
A very run of the mill operation. Nothing special
25.title: “Nice rooms - very large bathrooms”

description: The accommodation was perfect for our family get together - there was some decorating going on but nothing that spoilt our time there - the staff could not have been more helpful and they were so friendly and always had a smile :-) . The breakfast was fab!!
The location was perfect!! in amongst all the bars and restaurants but with good easy access to the beach - it was a little haven of peace in amongst the hubbub of the busy main street.

We took a trip to the Gili Islands just off Lombok...we found paradise for snorkelling and diving...we will defo be back to Seminyak Suites and also take a few days in the Gili Islands next time.There is so much here to see!!!
The Balinese people are so friendly and we weren't pestered that much except sometimes on the beach.
As Arnie said....we'll be back!!!

The service here is excellent, you will always see smiley staffs who greeted you and asked about your day :) My husband and I were also impressed that every staff we met for the itenary planned (Eg, spa/ cooking class/ candlelight dinner) they are all aware that it's our second stay and the schedule we had even though it's the first time we met them.
The location is really convenient, when you walk out there are boutiques, restaurants, cafes, bars, supermarket, convenient store.
Their spa experience was great too! Although it is more expensive than the massage and spa found along the streets but the service and overall experience is really can't be compared.
Money spent is really worth it and definitely a great place for Honeymoon!
Photos and more details are added to my blog: illusorydoll.blogspot.sg ^^

We couldn't have been happier with our accommodation. the rooms were beyond our expectations and the staff made our stay even more enjoyable. good location and value for money, would definitely revisit !

Loved it here, close to the shops yet once down the laneway you couldnt hear any of the traffic noise, the staff were wonderful and very friendly. The room had small flaws but certainly none that would stop me going back, not a place for small children as there isnt a wall between the lounge/kitchen area and the pool, but great otherwise.
Me, my husband and a two boys (3 years , 4 years) stayed in the two rooms villa for 5 nights and it was amazing.

The location is the best where you are in the middle of the shops restaurants, shops, money exchanger and mini market is all over the street in which the villas are. But it is very quite and relaxing and you can not hear anything from the noises and the buzz of the street. The swimming pool is huge we used to go for tours for all day and came back to have fun and relax in our very private pool. And the bathroom is very huge with a huge bath tube .Staff very friendly. Has our own kitchen we actually used to make our dinners there ;). But one thing they should improve is the breakfast buffet it has all the essentials but need to improve a little .
It was the best vacation in bali with this beautiful specious and private villa.
30.title: “The best in everything”

description: I stayed in a 2 bedroom villa for 10 nights with my brother last year. Loved it, great service and the rooms are nice. There are better villas in Bali for the same sort of money but it was a nice place. Don't go there if you plan on listening to the radio at lunch time over a few drinks as we were told to keep it down at midday. Probably a fair call however there was only two of us so we weren't exactly having a party.
I spent 5 nights at one of the two room villas recently and had a great experience.
If you are travelling with couples these villas are perfect as there is some space between the rooms, which are clean and well appointed.
The staff are very nice and helpful.

Our flight into Bali was moved forward by our airline so we asked for an early check in. The villas were all full so the staff arranged a layover at their sister resort for a half a day for free until our villa was ready. 10 points for this as we had no sleep and would have been in a bit of strife if they hadn't done this.

The only reason I'm not giving these villas full points is because the room service food is terrible. Probably because it is prepared in their sister resort and is cold by the time it reaches the villas.
Aside from that, this was my fifth time to Bali and I'd stay at The Seminyak Private Villas again.

This was our first visit to Bali. I was very worried about booking accommodation based on the information shown on the website but we were extremely happy to find the villas exactly same as what is described on the website. Excellent service, 15m long private clean pool, big rooms & bathrooms, cleaned daily with everything replaced and fresh, no Mosquitos and very close to shops & restaurants yet very peaceful!!!! Money worth spent! We highly recommend the place and definitely will stay in the same place if we revisit Bali. Thank you!!!
I would go back here in a heart beat! Kids loved it, and the staff were so accommodating there is nothing they wouldn't do. Cleanliness was fantastic and so was the food.
The villas were in a great location in the heart of everything but still nestled enough away down a driveway to enjoy some peace and quiet.

We enjoyed staying here so much in April 2014 that the kids pestered me to to come back. Staff very friendly, service was brilliant. Location is great, Good restaurants, shopping and beach within easy walking distance even for my 5 yr old. Very easy to organise transport to any where else Kuta Ubud etc. We have 3 kids 5 to 7 and the great thing is that you dont have to go anywhere if you dont feel like it, you just roll out of bed and chill around the pool. Very private once you are in the Villa and loads of room. We stayed in 3 bedroom suite and bedrooms and bathrooms are massive, quite often my three kids all slept in the same room.
Breakfast every morning is really good, make sure to ask for a banana pancake.
Only negatives is the room service menu is fairly uninspiring, good enough if you really dont feel like going out but not much more, Also Wifi will drop out reasonably often and make you re sign in.
Overall though it is a brilliant place to stay if you are a family and enjoy privacy and relaxation. Also the option of a three bedroom villa that alot of alternatives dont offer.
I have already promised the kids we will be back next year.
35.title: “Beautiful Family Villas in Seminyak”

description: This was our fist visit to this property and we found that the accommodation is excellent. Huge bedrooms, even bigger bathrooms and the open air kitchen/dining room is great and suits the Bali lifestyle perfectly. Having our own generously sized private pool was fabulous and our teenagers used it extensively. All the staff are absolutely delightful, so polite, friendly and accommodating - no request was ever a problem. The location is right on busy Seminyak Road - very central and close to shops and restaurants but once down the drive and in the villa, it was very peaceful and quiet. We only had breakfast there but it was more than sufficient with a good variety and lovely staff. I would definitely recommend this property to anyone wanting to be central but have privacy and be well looked after.

My girlfriend and I stayed here last week and can't speak highly enough of the place and service. There are shops and restaurants close by and the traffic associated with this but once inside the Villa and in the pool area you wouldn't even know there was a main road close by. The service and friendly hello's received from desk staff to restaurant personnel were very welcoming and the staff went out of their way to make you feel special and ensure you had a good time on holiday. We would definitely stay here again and are counting down the days until our next visit.

This was the last stop of our honeymoon in Indonesia and as soon as we walked into our private suite we knew we had chose well. The suite was immaculately clean, including our own private pool. The outdoor kitchen area had everything you need although we didn't actually cook ourselves but did have a 5 course meal included in our package where a chef and waiter came to our suite to cook and serve dinner for us.

All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Sorted out a driver for a day for us to visit the monkey forest, see a traditional barong dance and try the luwak coffee at a place that actually produces that type of coffee and several other types of coffees and teas.
We also had a spa treatment within our package that was very good - this was at another one of the villa complexes a 5 minute shuttle drive away that was provided by the seminyak suites.
The bed was very comfortable and large and the shower was very nice as well.

It would have been good to have some more time there to enjoy the suite a little bit more but we still had enough time there to make us want to return some time. We don't understand the bad reviews on here but maybe not all suites are as nice as the one that we had as there was no issues whatsoever with ours.
We definitely would go back again.

Back again ( 4-5th time ) and unfortunately we find things slowly deteriorated. Cannot fault the staff , from gardeners to security and reception for friendliness however service has fallen with being moved around within villas to accommodate other arrivals to wifi dropping out every few minutes. Unfortunately my comments of two years ago still stand as far as the food goes. Breakfast is hard to fault however all other meals still pretty ordinary and nothing on the menu has changed in several years. We stayed in the sister resort six months ago and that also was disappointing. Sorry guys a lot will have to be done for us to stay here again.

My Partner and I stayed at the Seminyak suite Private Villas in August, 2014. This place is beautiful it is close to shops and restaurants but offers peace and tranquility. Very private for those that enjoy their own time. The staff are so helpful,the rooms are huge and offer all that is required. My birthday fell when we were there and my partner along with the staff organised a beautiful day for myself, including individual touches with rose petals in the bath, roses on the bed, birthday cake, day of relaxation at the spa house and a candlelit dinner with our own personal chef and waiter. Nothing was too much for this place. I would certainly recommend this place to anybody, very reasonably priced for what you get.
40.title: “Beautiful place to stay”

description: We stayed at the Seminyak private villas on the second leg of our trip after staying at the sister hotel Seminyak Estate & Spa.. and i must say that these villas are Fabulous..
The suite isn't as large as the Estate hotel but they are more modern,the children were in the room across from the awesome courtyard pool which gave us all the privacy we needed.
The suites are set back from the Main Street of Seminyak shopping so makes them private and comfortable not to hear the traffic or all the noise.

Staff were great, made sure that our every need was met and so helpful when asked for advice on what are the best places to visit, security is great and thorough and definitely made us feel much safer..
The buggy that drove us between the resorts is a great idea if you want to eat at either of the villas.
Will be staying at these resorts again and bringing friends!!
Thank you again for everything..

Nice we enjoyed our stay will certainly come back and would tell all my friends to choose seminyak villas,the only thing we were missing is in your breakfast menu there was no indian style like idly,dosa,upma etc.... Hope plz add this to your menu and sure everyone will love it instead of the same noodles or the fried rice. Not but the least all the staff were really good keep up the good work and I want to thank budi and Indra for making our short stay at seminyak suite a memorable one.
Once again thank you guys great work:)))))
Ravindra

this was our first stay at Seminyak Suites and can't wait to go back. Set back from legian road so is very quiet. all staff are very friendly and always say hello.nothing was to much trouble. had an in villa bbq with cook and butler for partners birthday and it was excellent. rooms are private so if you want that all over tan just lock the external door to your villa and away you go.if a couple get the 1 bedroom villas i think we had villa 17 which was a nice layout. 6m x 3m pool which was about 1.5 deep so was refreshing but not too cold.bathrooms could possibly be updated/painted but but none of this affets your sleep or comfort. go and enjoy highly recommended

Villas are in a good location for shopping. Very Quiet and Good Security! Short walk to Bintang supermarket. A good 10-15 min walk to the more restaurant area but can easy cab it if wanted. Villas are a little tired but very comfortable, well set out. Own pool is great. Staff very helpful. Good selection for breakfast. Must try their Day Spa !!! very professional, was defiantly the best we had in Bali, (we left this for the last day but had tried others during our stay.) Would defiantly stay there again.
This was our second stay at Seminyak Suites in the past 8 months. I think that speaks volumes about the villas.

Seminyak Suites are centrally located along Jalan Legian, but set back off the street enough to be remarkably quiet given the location. The rooms are large, the bathrooms opulent, and the swimming pool wonderful.
The staff at SS are attentive, friendly and go out of their way to make a stay here as relaxing as possible. Can't recommend this place highly enough.
45.title: “Second time round”

description: The pool was the most impressive amenity to me at the villa. Good size and most importantly, very clean. Next , the bedding and pillows- very comfy and not too soft. Surprising they have a very good sound system in the living area. Nice music for a leisure night swim. Security was good.. They patrolled around the villa quite a bit esp at night. What needs to be done better is the overall maintenance of the villa. Villa is rather old and there are signs of low maintenance. If some efforts are put into refurbishment, i am sure you will get 5 stars from all your guests :)and finally, please install a TV at the living area. Overall, a pleasant stay with friendly staff and tight security.
villa is located at shopping street. a 5 min walk takes you to the local bintang supermarket. also plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. safe as security is pretty tight.
rather good and prompt service by hotel staff. bathroom is huge with air con. pool was small but was cleaned daily. villa was well-equipped.

however, we found the hotel rather dated as mentioned by other travellers. felt that the villa could be cleaner as there was a thin layer of dust on the furniture. air-con had a buzzing sound but it did not affect us. dvd player does not work well.
overall, an ok stay.
What a fabulous and very safe location
Easy access to Shops cafés supermarket massages and anything you want
Staff were super friendly and assisted with anything you wanted/ needed
Breakfast great buffet is served on site and occasionally at their sister premises - if this did happen staff transported you in a buggy
Bedrooms were serviced everyday and kept extremely clean

Pool was exceptionally clean ( water ) however there was signs of wear and tear and a bit grimey in places outside the pool mainly around the steps - looks as though the place is undergoing renos so this small issue may be resolved
The location however made up for this short coming as did the beautiful staff - especially Putra who was just gorgeous in every way possible and ever so helpful
Our first reaction: Excellent!!! I stayed at two hotels during my stay in Bali for 5-6 days in different area, this one was best!!

Place: As the name suggest, it’s a stunning villa with all the facilities you require for your private stay. Being in Seminyak heart, you will have all the shopping locations within your reach. Property may not be super-duper from outside around reception area or parking (Small reception, parking, lounge) but once you enter in your villa, its heaven!!! Hotel make sure to arrange your room with anything you have requested earlier.

Villa, Rooms & facilities: Clean, spacious and marvelous. We stayed in 1 bedroom apartment and it was huge. Bathroom was big & beautiful like a room and we especially loved the bathtub which is integrated with floor. Pool size is sufficient for 2. Since it was open kitchen around Pool and sitting area, it gives you a very nice romantic experience!!! Cleaning of pool, villa and open area also happens every day (as per your wish)!! Breakfast is served to your villa, hotel generally offer a wide variety of breakfast options to deliver to your villa so that you don’t need to step out. They will arrange breakfast\dinner at your table. More, you can impress your better half with some good culinary skills with a kitchen around, which I definitely didn’t miss. However, you should ask for fresh culinary set from hotel. I loved room location wrt pool and open area, it gives you a feeling of a pool view room. Bed & Bed Linen are also of premium quality. Room has wooden floor which was well maintained and the living area is also well designed. I wished they use more premium Sofa in the room. But that shouldn’t cut any points. Another wish is a bigger lounge area. We couldn’t use their services like SPA and dance\food festival dining as we avail them elsewhere, so cant comment on that.

Staff: This is one point I will give full marks to this hotel. Amazing courteous helpful Staff. They assisted us in finding right routs, places to shop, currency conversion, apart from regular villa related help. Served us food in odd hours also which was beyond time mentioned in their menu. Took a great care of cleanliness and our safety when we go out and ask for Do-don’ts.

Recommended: Highly. If you are in Bali, do stay in Private Villa properties for once. It’s a great experience. This hotel, is one the best. Do check out their new property as well if you like to stay a little far from all busyness!!
This private villa is an excellent choice if you are looking for a little peace and quiet away from busy Kuta.
The staff were very friendly, the service was good and the private pool was exceptional.

The only comment I can make is that the resort needs a coat of paint in some places, but overall I would recommend this establishment to other travellers looking for a nice quiet private villa with a private pool.
50.title: “Great private villa in Seminyak”

description: The staff at Seminyak Suites are friendly and helpful, could not fault the service. The villas are quiet and private with everything you need. The breakfasts are above average but if you don't want to stay for breakfast there are plenty of other options close by. Would be happy to stay there again.

As an older couple we like our peace and quiet at night for sleeping but I found that we were the noisy ones! There I was at 9.00p.m. swimming around in our own pool and all we could hear was me splashing around. The area was so peaceful, quiet and relaxing even throughout the day. The villas are large, the bathrooms even bigger than the bedroom. The outside did it for us. Nice day bed, large frig for all your purchases from the Bintang supermarket just down the road and that lovely pool kept clean at all times. Breakfast was nice with a reasonable variety and the banana pancakes were great. The staff were great - from reception to gardeners and security they all were so polite and helpful remembering our names and having our key ready for us on arrival every time. Even though the villas may need a paint and maybe new curtains to keep the heat out we enjoyed our stay very much. Would'nt hesitate to stay here again.

Recently returned from my birthday weekend in Bali and a stay in a one bedroom villa at "The Seminyak Suite Private Villa" (although the name suggests there is just one - there are several private villas on the property). Had a bit of a 'wow' moment when we opened the door and was greeted by the pool & sun loungers, open air lounge and kitchen areas. The place is massive for just two people - we were spoiled for space really. The villa is equipped with gas hobs, fridge/freezer (with usual mini-bar items), water dispenser, and in the bedroom; stereo system, flat screen TV, a lounge area and gigantic bathroom. In places the villa is slightly tired - but nothing a lick of paint wouldn't fix. The bathroom is unnecessarily large and features a sunken bath (which was not used), shower (again, needs painting, maintenance) vanity unit / sink, toilet (which was particularly old and not in a very good condition), and even air conditioning! The property is located right off the middle of Jln Raya Seminyak just 5 minutes walk to Bintang Supermarket and all that the main strip has to offer. The villa itself though (ours was 117) was very peaceful and you wouldn't think you're in the middle of one of Bali's busiest spots at all. The staff of the hotel were very friendly and helpful, and we were grateful for breakfast turning up and being cooked at our villa each morning. Very pleasant trip, would recommend to others - it was good value but there are some maintenance issues that need addressing, however we did see a few villas under going renovation (not something that affected our stay in any way at all) so perhaps they're working on that.

I was in Bali four three days for a stop over on my to Australia and decided to rent a villa suite since the prices were so reasonable. The Seminyak Suites are over the top and worth every penny. For half the price you would pay for a Garden Hilton in Toronto you get, two huge king size rooms and a personal pool with all the trimings. Also the ensuite bathroom in each room has an awsome shower room and a bath tub so big you could hide a volkwagen in it. We asked the front desk for some local transportation and they put us in touch with a local fellow who droves around for three days two all the awesome restaurants and in a brand new air conditioned Honda minivan for under two hundred U.S......we tipped him an extra hundred for the great service. Anyway this villa suites is quiet, clean, friendly and has no bugs. I hope you enjoy.

My girlfriend and I had a great time. We stayed in off peak season so for what we paid it was really exceptional. The rooms and pool were massive and it's an easy 10 min walk past plenty of shops and places to eat to the beach not to mention about a 3 dollar cab ride to anywhere else you could imagine in Seminyak. Would definitely recommend for anyone who wants a great value place with complete privacy.
55.title: “Ticked every box”

description: We recently stayed ten days at The Seminyak Suite Private Villa booking the villa based on their website information and photo gallery. I'd have to say that while the staff where all very friendly (Putu, Rini, Ari, Arthu, the gardener and all the guards) and keen for conversation, the 3 bedroom villa we stayed in did not resemble any of the photos shown on their website.

While the Villa was clean and spacious it was certainly a lot older (more dated) than the photos shown online. We also had continuous problems with birds nesting in the beams above the dining/ lounge area leaving little nuggets everywhere and efforts to remove them where at best half-hearted.

The breakfast was also a little disappointing. While eggs and pancakes could be cooked on the premises most of the food was supplied from the main villa complex 5+ mins away which also had a far bigger buffet selection to choose from.

Given what we paid to stay at the Villa's I'd have to say despite the best efforts of the staff to ensure an enjoyable stay the Villas are not up to the expectation they set (their promise) on their website.

Spent 4 nights at this villa with friends, received nothing but excellent services from the staff. Not to worry with language here as they understand and speak English proficiently. Villa itself was great, and rooms were spacious, so was the bathtub.

Wifi is provided, but do not expect lightning speed from it. A hifi set is provided in the common area, where you can dock your iPhone and blast your tunes while you take a dip in the pool. Lastly, a dvd player is provided in each room, but no DVDs provided for your browsing. No problems here as you can just head out to buy your own DVDs from the shops scattered just outside the villa.

Location wise it is about 30 mins from the airport, and it can be a tricky place to find even by the local drivers. From the villa, you can walk about anywhere to get your dining, entertainment, shopping and groceries needs (there is a large local supermarket just down the road from the villa). As for the clubbing scene, it probably takes about another 15 mins from the villa. All in all, great amenities within easy reach.
Feel free to browse the accompanying pictures for an idea of the villa is :)
Enjoy your trip!
We have just returned from a holiday in Bali during which we spent four nights at the Seminyak Suite Private Villa.

Our family of two adults and two teenage children stayed in a two bedroom pool villa which was perfect. Each of the bedrooms were very spacious with their own sitting area, large ensuite with a huge stone bath. Between the bedrooms was a comfortable living, dining and kitchen area overlooking the private pool. The villa and pool were very clean and well maintained as were the beautiful gardens.

The location is very convenient with good security, the main road is at the end of the driveway. A beautifully private and tranquil oasis only moments from everything. We walked back from restaurants near Seminyak Square. Another bonus is the large supermarket only a few doors away.
The staff all went out of their way to ensure we felt welcome and always called us by name. The room also included free WiFi which we had no problems accessing and filtered water.
We had a very enjoyable stay and would definitely return.
Seminyak Suite's should be a great place and be up there with the best villa hotels in Seminyak, many of which I have stayed at, however they fall just short in a number of quite critical areas.

First the good things: excellent location, reasonable value, good layout of rooms, shared spaces and pools in the villa compounds, great facilities and service, and very friendly and accommodating staff.

These are, however, slightly overshadowed by a few niggly things that just make your stay there a little bit irritating: no ceiling fans in the bedrooms so you have to have the AC on all the time, no ceiling fans in the open dining/kitchen area, not enough accessible power points to plug in cameras, phones etc, wi-fi which is patchy at best and very large 8 seater dining table but only 2 comfortable lounge chairs to use.

There was also the very irritating, and potentially dangerous situation when the staff failed to let us know that there would be a Temple ceremony that night which involved street blockages and and total black-out of all lights. This meant being dropped off by the taxi a kilometer from the hotel and having to find our way back through unfamiliar and totally dark streets. When we tried to use our phones as torchlights in the street we were hissed at and told that no lights were allowed.

This is not a comment on or a whinge about the Ceremony and the customs, which we were very happy to respect and adhere too, but more on the hotel staff for not letting us know that this would be happening that night.

You would expect that hotels in Seminyak with foreign guests unfamiliar with the area and the ceremony nights would have established processes and protocols in place, most particularly for big celebrations such as Nyepi with 24 hours of no lights or power!

When we arrived at this establishment I was very ill. From the moment that the reception staff realised this, they were able to expedite a room for us and arranged a very fast early check in. The villa itself was a little tired, however not in any way that was detrimental to our stay. We stayed for a week and thoroughly enjoyed our time here. The outdoor kitchen was very handy. The room was very large and comfortable. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The villa was very private and secure. The location is very central, only metres away from Bintang supermarket. The hustle and bustle is right outside, however inside the villa it was very quiet and peaceful. We would stay here again.
60.title: “A very pleasant stay”

description: This was such a breathtaking place. The grounds themselves were massive and beautiful. The villa was very private, hardly heard noise from our neighbours. The pool was huge and the villa really spacious. The rooms were large and really clean. Breakfast was of high standard and staff were really friendly. The spa located off premise was exceptional. The grounds were always so quite and peaceful and in such a good location. The reception was always willing to do anything for us. Can't pick any faults. Any small troubles and there was someone at our door within minutes.
We stayed in this hotel from 16 to 19 Dec 2013. This is a summary of our stay:
What we like:
- The staff were mostly friendly, especially the gardeners and room service staff. Everyone would greet and smile at you.
- They were able to serve and cook you breakfast at your villa, if you are too lazy to eat out for breakfast.
- The bathtub was huge but this could be a problem if you have young children - please do not let them use the bathtub on their own.
- Location was great, convenient and central. There is even a supermarket and money changer with very good rates located 5 minutes from the villa.
What we didn't like:
- Wifi access was non-existent. We called the reception to look into this but nothing was done. The network could not be detected at all.
- The toilet flush was extremely weak; we sought for a technician to fix it. The technician arrived, somewhat fixed it, but the toilet flush remained the same.
- Once you fill up the bathtub with hot water, you would have run out of hot water for your shower.
- There were flies buzzing around us as we ate our breakfast and while we swim as well. Having said that, this seemed to be a common problem throughout other parts of Bali.
- The pool did not seem very inviting in the evening as there is only one source of light.
- The villa and room were rather dimly-lit at night. As I like reading at night, the lighting was a serious source of problem for me.
- The walkway and the pathway towards the villa was very, very dark! It could be rather scary if you are walking back alone at night.
- Breakfast is also served at the other property they had which they would need to take you via their buggy. We found this troublesome.
We spent two nights here in December.
Very friendly staff. Perfect large two bedroom villa. Very large bedrooms and a beautiful bathroom.
The pool was large for a villa, which meant our children could splash and play.
The large outdoor area is comfortable, although it could do with a ceiling fan.
Breakfast was a buffet and was fine. My children enjoyed the freshly made chocolate chip pancakes.
Wish we could have spent longer there.
Just returned from a week @ the Seminyak Suites for our honeymoon - first time at this particular villa, but definitely won't be our last stay there.

Thoroughly professional staff as well as that traditional, Balinese friendliness you come to expect when staying on the island. The villa is realistically more "Legian" than "Seminyak" itself, but that was no problem for us as we've been to Bali a few times over recent years. The villas themselves were situated back off Jl. Legian and short of kids with firecrackers late at night, you wouldn't know there was a busy road nearby.

We had a single suite, but it was the biggest room two people could have to themselves; the bathroom was the size of our master bedroom @ home (bath & separate shower place); and the private pool made cooling off in the heat of the day too easy - just the right size for two. Air con in the bedroom (and bathroom!!??) was absolutely sensational also.

We took the opportunity to have a Balinese cooking lesson, organised through the front desk at another (very close by) property run by the same group. If you like playing in the kitchen, this is definitely well worth the time - not just Indo cooking, but more traditional Balinese style recipes (and they throw in a recipe book to boot!!)
There are two bed villas also available, making the Seminyak Suites great for families or for two couples. Cannot recommend this place enough.

We booked a 3d/2n three bedroom villa for $650 over at agoda. It was such a great value for money. The rooms, bathrooms and common area are clean, spacious and well equipped. It is located near shops and restaurants but some 30 minute leisurely walk to the beach.
Although we were accorded with late check-out upto 1pm only, we were very pleased that we were provided with a room to take a shower at the end of the day before our red-eye flight.
Would recommend this place for those looking for a quiet hideaway, near shops but afar from the beach that's great value for money.
65.title: “Quaint Private Villa with Great Value for Money”

description: We were warmly welcomed and offered a refreshing welcome drink. Our room was clean and had some fresh fruit waiting for us. The bathroom is large with a separate bath and shower. There is a sitting area both in the bedroom area (with air con) and in the outside kitchen/dining/lounge pool area.
The hotel is close to a supermarket so you can buy some drinks to store in the hotel fridge and, if you feel like cooking, the kitchen is fully equipped.
The room comes with filtered water and free wifi which is a major plus when we were booking.

The staff were always friendly and helpful, offering spa and restaurants suggestions and helping get taxis. When we would return from walking down the street, they would ask us how we are and were genuinely interested in our conversations.
This was our second stay at the hotel.
The location of the hotel is fantastic. Walk down the driveway (security at each end) and you are on the main road. Shops lining the street, restaurants and coffee shops close buy.
Great location, great concept and layout of villas, pool amazing with fantastic privacy.
The staff are great and attentive.
The only downfall is the cheap furniture and finishes of the Villas, the interior design is a little dated and cheap feeling. The cleanliness could be improved as could the buffet breakfast.

We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa for one night and it was absolutely amazing. The villa was very clean with an amazing pool between both rooms. The bathrooms were stunning with beautiful big stone bath tubs in each room. The buffet breakfast was lovely and the staff were very welcoming and friendly. Will definitely be coming back to stay here :)
Just got back from staying 4 nights in a 2 brm villa.
Fantastic accommodation in a great spot.
Having stayed in Seminyak a few times this would go down as being one of the best.
The staff are lovely. We loved the way we got greeted by our names every time we walked pasted reception. My daughter stated it made her feel special and indeed I agree.
At front desk Arrie (so hope I spelt her name right) made our holiday special by booking restaurants ect and loved her smiling face every time we returned home.
Even the security guards at reception and near the front entrance where nice.
Assisting us with taxi's and crossing the road.
Only one thing I can suggest is a main tv in the middle living area.
There are tv's in each of the brms but his makes it difficult when a family wants to watch tv and dvd's together.Other than that a very enjoyable stay.
Would love to stay again.

Great place ! Close to everything ! Wonderful set-up ! I wish all my holidays were like this ! We stayed in this huge 2 bedroom villa, with our own private pool ! Going around , eating out, going to the beach was very easy, the staff also attended to our needs and wishes right away...Will definitely go back
70.title: “What can I say .... Wow !”

description: This was our second stay at The Seminyak Suite Private Villa and, whilst the paint work is showing a little wear and tear which we are sure will be fixed in the near future, the staff, service and facilities were just as we remembered them, first class. Our package included complimentary airport pick up and we were very pleased to see our driver had stayed around even though our flight was delayed by over 6 hours. The complimentary breakfasts had a great range of food available, the complimentary massages were great and the beach drop offs were very useful. The villa, which has a private pool and plenty of space, is situated down a driveway in the middle of Seminyak and is surrounded with a variety of bars and restaurants as well as a variety of shops but is much less noisy and frenetic than Kuta. There is also a good supermarket nearby which supplies all you need should you decide to spend most of your time in the privacy of your villa. A great place to escape to.

Just back from this villa; stayed in a 2 bedder with a mate and his wife. Bedroom and bathroom were always well maintained, clean and air-conditioning always left on (it's been sweltering hot in Bali recently) so it was nice to come back to a nice cool room.

Sandwiched in the middle of the two rooms was the outdoor area, which consists of the excellent pool, lounge area (with stereo/radio system) and the kitchenette. The only gripe we had was the glaring omission of a ceiling fan! I suppose they expect you jump into the pool to cool off ;-)
Location is perfect, well hidden off the main shopping street and a 50m walk down the driveway.

Being a 17 villa estate; you would hardly bump into any of the hotel guests except during breakfast of course.....which was really nothing to shout about. Overall though I would definitely be back mainly due to the extremely friendly staff, location to shops and well maintained accommodation.

We rented the two bedroom villas and found the rooms to be very clean and comfortable. The staff at the reception went out of their way to accommodate every request. The morning breakfast, which is included, was delicious, especially the banana chocolate chip and fresh pineapple pancakes!! Would highly recommend this hotel.
With four other couples we were on our first holiday in Bali and booked a 3 and a 2 bedroom villa.
From the moment the doorway to our villa was opened...the wow factor kicked in.
The pool and outdoor living and kitchenette area...and then inside to the bedrooms and bathrooms...all sparkling clean and so spacious.
The staff...from the front security, the desk staff, through to the cleaners and gardeners were always welcoming and happy.....something staff in Aussie hotels could learn from.
Breaky was included and while it was no Sheraton had great variety.
Also included in our package was a 1 hour massage each and also a 3 course lunch....and airport transfers.
Where in Australia can you get such quality and value for the price???
The villa's could probably do with a coat of paint, hopefully the owners maintain the buildings to a standard to match the excellence of the service provided by Rini, Putu and the rest of the staff.

For a family of 5 we rented a 3 bedroom villa, the room was spotless, the bathroom slightly water stained but again spotless, the swimming pool and entertainment area spotless. The staff were efficient and friendly and the breakfast included in the price was excellent. Now you can only judge on what you see and how you are treated, we were treated like royalty or so I thought after the 1hour massage. Seminyak may not be your favourite place in Bali, we preferred the markets in Kuta, but I don't know how you can fault the Seminyak suites accommodation,except the bed looked spectacular but was quite uncomfortable.
75.title: “Treated like a king”

description: We stayed here for six nights in a three bedroom villa and felt very comfortable. The staff are warm and friendly- they even remembered the name of my daughter's teddy bear! The villa was very clean and large. The pool was amazing and was well looked after. The breakfast selection has everything you need (I loved the banana pancakes) and the hotel staff are only to happy to organise tours/massages/transfers for you. It is very close to good shopping and the Bintang supermarket. You are very close to the beach. We felt very safe and secure with the security guards who even help you to cross a busy street when you need to. The room service is amazing and I am sorry I didn't get to try everything I wanted to. I highly recommend this place as it went above and beyond what we were expecting. Book here as you won't be disappointed!

We were three families all looking for different requirements. The villas catered to each families needs. The rooms were absolute luxury. The villas are very central to shopping and nice restaurants, located all just at the top of the lane way. The gardens are meticulously kept and a pool man comes to check the chlorine levels every day in your own private pool. Meals and cocktails can be ordered to your room at any time. The staff right from the cleaners, gardeners, reception girls, breakfast staff, security and even the guys at the end of the lane way (to help stop the traffic for you to cross the road) could not be more helpful or polite! Nothing was ever too much trouble. They even came each night to spray our rooms for any Mosquitos. Rini at front reception gave us so many tips and became like a family member by the end of our stay. We loved it here so much it would be very hard to beat and would recommend anyone to stay here.

Without doubt one of the worst hotel experiences of my life. The room smelt of cigarette smoke (we're non smokers), the villa itself was horribly unclean, the sheets were dirty and the bath had mould in it. Originally booked for 2 nights, left after 14 hours. Wouldn't give refund on 2nd night even after showing the state of the room and the concierge telling me they had at least 1-2 complaints PER WEEK from their guests re: the condition of their room. Would recommend no one ever book here.

Stayed here for 5 days. Good value for money, found a deal on the internet. Nice size pool that received sunlight until 3 in the afternoon. Kitchen, table and cooking facilities are outside under cover.
Had breakfast each morning in the restaurant, not a large choice of hot foods but great choice of everything else, eggs cooked to order.
Staff very helpful, booked all our tours and evening meals at different restaurant's for us and organised taxis.
Security at entrance which also helped you cross the busy road. Lovely gardens and pathways to the villas. Some noise from roosters close by, we were at the end so did not hear.
Location is fantastic, close to many excellent restaurants and a quick walk to the beach. Restaurant's we enjoyed while staying there were GADA GADA, Cocoon and the Pearl Restaurant, a real find.
Had a free 1 hour massage across the road at there larger facility, which was great.
Room was kept cleaned and serviced daily. Did not have a problem with mosquitos.
Would stay here again.

My stay at Seminyak Suite Private Villa was fantastic. The villa comes with huge bath....clean room and most of all a nice cool private pool. The villa was maintain daily with their staff cleaning the bedroom and the pool. Staffs were really friendly...always greeting Hi or Good morning when they see me.

Breakfast was okay. The banana pancake was the highlight for me. Really soft and nice. Location is near to a supermarket, cafes and some shops. 15mins walking distance to the beach. Overall I am satisfy with the stay....and i will go back again. :)
80.title: “Great Stay with Great Service”

description: From the time we walked into our Villa till the time we left 9 days later we were totally relaxed thanks to the incredibly hard working, courteous and friendly staff. Nothing was too much for them. We were greeted warmly by everyone at every occasion right from the gardeners and pool guys through to the staff who cleaned and serviced our Villa, the staff who attended us at breakfast and the lovely ladies at reception, Putu, Rini and Ari, always smiling and remembering our names. We were made to feel as if we were their only customers deserving of their fullest attention. The Seminyak Suites should feel very proud of their staff and their premises. We stayed in a 3 bedroom Villa and did not feel the need to leave it very often. The food that was provided at breakfast in the restaurant was very good with ample choices. We chose to have 2 evening meals in the Villa which were both very tasty and plentiful. We will definitely be returning at our earliest opportunity.

Fantastic suites, staff and friendly atmosphere. I couldn't speak more highly of the location, the surrounding businesses and even the entertainment. The staff were all happy, smiling, helpful and courteous and even their recommendations were on point.
Their second facility just a 2 minute buggy ride away was superb but it was nice to be in the smaller more peaceful villas.

After hearing good and bad reviews about Bali itself, me and my fiancee were apprehensive about going. However, as soon as the taxi arrived at The Seminyak suite and we were greeted with a drink and towel we felt relaxed and excited for our stay. When we taken to our Villa we were absolutely amazed at how much outside space there was and the villa was immaculate! So peaceful aswell. The staff were exceptional! Could not do enough for you! Even gave us an English adapter as we had forgot to bring one! Cocktails delivered to our villa on request and the staff always used our names when talking to us. Always smiling! The villas are looked after so well, having daily housekeeping, pool is cleaned daily and the gardener was there daily! Our bed was absolutely massive and the bathroom was HUGE! Breakfast was good and they even bring it to your villa which was FAB!

Location wise it was near to alot of shops restaurants and bars and it cost approx $1 to get to the main trip near Seminyak Square. It was our first time in Bali and we cannot wait to book again .After having such an amazing time at The Seminyak Suite we are reluctant to try anywhere else incase it doesnt compare! Defintely would recommend as I have to my friends and work collegues and we will be going back. Thanks The Seminyak Suite

My husband and I have just returned from our stay of eight nights. On arrival we were pleasantly surprised at the tranquility of our own private villa as the location is such a hustling, bustling street of shops, bars and restaurants. The service and staff are second to none; in particular we would like to thank Rini and Iri on Reception and also Mede who cleaned our villa daily. The staff in the breakfast room were friendly and helpful. We had massages at the sister property and found the staff there to be equally accommodating. All in all we had a very comfortable, pleasant and enjoyable stay in an environment of lovely, smiley, happy people.

The service and staff are amazing. My husband contracted Dengue Fever when we stayed at Legian, so when we arrived he was quite ill. They took us to the hospital looked after the kids while I waited with him and then drove us home. They went to visit him in hospital with flowers and a fruit basket. When he was discharged they picked him up then drove him back every day for his blood tests, nothing is too much trouble for them we you see what they did for us. The villas are very private, clean and spacious. There sister property is across the road so you can go over there for breakfast if you like or have it at the restaurant at the villas. They change the sheets and towels daily and clean, villa, pool and do the garden, it is just amazing. Thye fog for mozzies twice a week and supply, coils, spray etc. I think you could just about ask for anything and they would arrange it for you.
85.title: “I will never stay anywhere else in Bali”

description: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights in a beautiful 2 bedroom villa (115) .... They did close the 2nd bedroom off, (I had a peak through the window and I did notice that it was two single beds if that is of any interest to somebody). We arrived very late at night due to our plane being delayed but the driver was waiting and check in at 1.30am was done very quick and smoothly. Breakfast was quite nice, everything was there but not over the top. Included in our package was a 1.5hr massage that was lovely and relaxing over at the other villa estate. I did book this hotel on the premise that it was more of a couples retreat, but the few days we were there it seemed to be full of families, (and one noisy baby!) .... it wasn't a problem, the villas are far enough apart that the noise really was only background. The rooms were nicely decorated and comfortable. There are numerous restaurants not far from the villas (Pearl on double 6 was fab!) and I would have no hesitation in staying again.

My wife and I stayed 7 nights during July after having spent 3 nights in Ubud. Despite being located in the middle of Seminyak on a very busy road and within 100m of Bintang Supermarket its quiet and refreshingly private. We stayed in Villa 117 and found it very comfortable. The pool was a delight, crystal clear and so welcome morning and night. The bathroom enormous and the sunken bath truly remarkable. It would have been nice however to have a little more storage space as hanging room and cupboard space are limited.The staff however were fantastically friendly. From Rini and Putu in reception, to Roy our Poolman to Wini and Wedi at the spa it was hard to fault their desire to help. A big thankyou to you all for making our stay memorable. Our only criticism would be lack of detail - for example used glasses and plates lay on a ledge opposite our Villa for 3 days before being removed, at breakfast sometimes the table was completely made sometimes not, we accidently broke a cup on the tiles in the our kitchen but for 3 days it was not removed or replaced and was only replaced when asked. The property also does look a little tired and could do with makeover, our kitchen tap leaked when used, the auto bathroom sink plug didn't quiet work properly and repairs to brickwork remain unpainted. These were minor issues however and certainly didnt detract from a wonderful holiday.Thanks again, we'd love to see you all agin soon.
We all had a absolutely fabulous time in bali the accommodation was perfect staff sensational.

Breakfast in the mornings was great and staff were lovely greeting us by name everyday and did not forget who has who. They booked taxis for us and they were always there within 5 mins. and when leaving the villa security always stopped the cars so we could cross the road. Very clean could not have asked for any more and thank you for making it a very memorable holiday.
Thanks so much..... Fiona

We had a two bedroom villa which was absolutely beautiful. Cannot thank the staff enough for their help and friendliness - from security helping us cross the road to the breakfast staff who ensured my favourite tiny bananas were delivered each morning to my table. When it came to leaving, they even gave us a later checkout than originally arranged so we weren't left waiting in reception.

Well from the moment that my family arrived at Seminyak Suite Private Villa`s we were made feel so welcome.Thank you to all the friendly staff for making this holiday so pleasant.The villa`s were very nice,great location and very well maintained.We have no hesitation in the future to come back to Bali and stay at your villa`s.
Once again thanks for a great holiday.
Greg McGrath.
Melbourne.Australia.
90.title: “Fantastic first trip to Bali!!”

description: We went to Bali on our 2nd honeymoon..chose to stay in Seminyak Suites against suggestions of all. But to our delight , the 1 bedroom pvt pool villa that we booked were super awesome ! The moment we entered the villa..we were happy... after 8 hours of air travel..we were exhausted but the sheer luxury of the villa relaxed us !
the hotel itself is very quiet and those looking for some private time , this is it !

Rooms are all neat and tidy...usually the pool area is dirty and water not clean..but unlike other places the pvt pool had auto cleaning system which filtered water every morning so the water in the pool will be ready for you to go in.

Food : we only took breakfasts in the hotel , which for us didnt go well. Me n wifey are vegen..so for us it was not the best place to eat....the chef did try to give us some veg dishes but that didnt work with us..

Reach : the hotel is centrally located in the busy streets of Seminyak....lots of boutique stores all around..and the only good Indian Restaurant " Queen's Tandoor " is just 5 mins walk from the hotel.
over all we were very happy with out stay :)

If its privacy and a bit of romance you are after, this is a great place to choose. The moment you unlock the huge wooden door to your private villa, you feel relaxed and at ease. Having your own pool, and breakfast served in your villa if you wish to be on your own, is a fabulous experience.The rooms are huge, the bathroom even bigger and the outdoor lounge is fabulous. I highly reccommend this place. The staff are beautiful, friendly and eager to please!

We stayed in a 2 bed villa with our 2 young children. It was wonderful and staff were exceptional, even buying a birthday cake for one of our party. Villa itself was great, only downside was the lack of plugs and clothes storage areas - such a minor issue.
Would definitely go back.

My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay in a two bedroom (one bedroom locked) villa from 22nd May to 27th May during our honeymoon trip to Bali. The staff were super efficient and we loved the private pool and the spa treatments (especially Balinese Massage). I will definitely stay at the Seminyak Suite Private Villa when I go to Bali again.

We stayed at this villa on 16-21 May 2013, in a group of 4. We booked one 2-bedroom villa. This was our first time to Bali and so lucky that we had such a nice experience there, at least, we love the environment in Villa. Staff in villa are so nice, lovely and helpful. When we called for service, they always came and gave us hands promptly. When staying there, we were so relaxing and felt so comfortable like at home. The Seminyak Suite is very convenient, it is just next to a bar/restaurant and near the villa, there are so many shops and restaurants (Japanese style, western style and some local mini restaurants on the streets, and even go to the beach, it only took 10-15 minutes on foot). Ya, just walked a few minutes, you will find a big supermarket there!! Even so, when you're in villa, you cannot imagine that you are actually in a town.

At one night, we had private BBQ in villa and we think that it was very good and nice. But two things we think they should be improved, are that the meats seems to be overcooked, that may be the Indonesian style but for us, would the Villa please consider to change the way (of course, we also forgot to remind the staff about our favorite) and another is that the kitchen was not cleaned completely after the BBQ. we understood that the staff worked so hard but the kitchen was a bit dirty as we had to stay there one more day. However, overall, we enjoyed the BBQ so much.
We decided to visit Bali again and must stay The Seminyak Suite again in next visit. We really enjoyed to stay there, and of course, we will recommend this villa to our friends.
We miss this villa & staff, we miss Bali.
95.title: “So lucky to stay there!”

description: We stayed at this villa in March in a group of 13. We hired out 1 x 3 bedroom pool villa & 1 x 2 bedroom pool villa.
We were travelling with 3 young children so the villa provided pool fences around all villas which was a necessity for us and was greatly appreciated.
The villa complex overall is fabulous, clean, modern and everything you need. They are spacious and VERY comfortable as your 'home away from home'
As you can tell from my reviews we are frequent travelers to Bali and this the Seminyak Suite is BY FAR the best location wise, step right out the front and you have everything you need.
Auth Money Changer, Bintang Supermarket, Shopping, Mini Mart, Massage, Spa, and restaurants.
We were also lucky enough to try out the hotels spa and it was AMAZING, well worth the prices they charge.

We stayed here over Nyepi day (traditional day in Bali, where you are not permitted to leave your villa), the hotel provided many options to the guests such as buffets options and having the spa open all day/night.
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this Villa and would highly recommend it to anyone wanting a modern spacious pool villa in a FAB location managed by genuinely happy and fantastic staff

Thank you for being able to accede to our request for a cake arrangement despite the short (1day) notice and thank you to your staff (lady) who immediately greeted the birthday boy with a 'Happy Birthday' the moment we arrived at your villa. Many thanks for the awesome service!

We had a pleasant stay at the villa for 2 nights despite the property being somewhat aged. The dining area was alright but the kitchenette was pretty rundown. The rooms were large and the beds were comfortable. Huge toilet, sink-in bath. There were a lot of mosquitoes all over, be it indoors (even in the toilet) or outdoors. Overall lighting was dim/dark, it would definitely be better if it was brighter or at least give the guests the option to dim/brighten the rooms or living area.

Location was good. There's a minimart along the main road, outside the villa, which makes it very convenient to get necessities (do note that they only accept cash payments). Overall, we enjoyed ourselves and thank you for the hospitality.

This was our second trip to this resort but this time we brought our teenage kids along. The 2 bedroom villa was great with the pool but I feel the villas could do with a fresh coat of paint as I noticed the outside walls looked a bit dirty. Also the kitchen looks a bit rundown now. Wanted to make toast one morning in villa but the toaster was very dirty and cupboards too. There were four of us staying but only two sun loungers available in villa.
Staff were lovely and always there to help..

We paid $3560 for 8 nights accommodation in a two bedroom private pool villa. I expected 5 star (in Asia) for this price and although nice the villas were not up to that standard. The rating is because of the friendly staff and the location.

The villa is set out nicely but the outside living area is a little warm and so one tends to be a bit anti social and spend time in the bedroom. We asked for a fan and one was provided immediately. This helped enormously as did the pool. There was a water dispenser with purified water in the living area.

The villas are a bit run down however apart from a couple of issues quite comfortable. In our room the bed was large and comfortable. It had a Doona which was a bit hot. We asked for a sheet and this was provided. There was no place to put suitcases or any space to put clothes other than on hangers. The bathroom was huge but had seen better days. There were no toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, body-wash) provided apart from one bar of soap. Yet there were toothbrushes, combs, cotton buds etc provided. The towels had seen better days. Beach towels were provided which was great.
