Rini at reception is so cute and lovely. Staff at the villas are very friendly - all of them - gardeners, room attendants, security guards and drivers. Never once do they pass you without a greeting. Location is great and the driveway is pleasant and not dodgy looking like many places we saw. Two security people are based there - one at the top near the road and one near reception. The one at the road will assist you to cross the street by stopping the traffic. The villas have lots of shops and restaurants close by.

There is a nIce Greek restaurant at the top of the driveway. We also had the free massage that was included in our tariff. It was lovely. I recommend the candlelight dinner in your villa (US $45 ea) It was fantastic!
A few hints
- a drying rack beside each bedroom would be handy. One was difficult for two couples.
- the bedside lamp needs a longer cord as I had to get out of bed to turn off lamp.
- more power points are needed in the bedroom. The only power points were beside the bed and in the bathroom.
- the shower walls and floor need a good scrub. Especially the wood near the taps and shower head.
- a chest of drawers would be handy as there is nowhere to put your non hanging clothes and we had to live out of our suitcase.

Everyone was warm & welcoming, and friendly all the time. The rooms were spotless & always attended to every day. Absolute privacy & was a very relaxing lovely holiday staying here. Would love to go back again. Thank you to every one of the staff members for making our stay a delightful one :-)
100.title: “Can't wait to come back”

description: We come to Bali twice a year for a minimum of 2 weeks at a time, this year we came a little earlier in the year but it was perfect. Seminyak suites, have the most comfortable beds, service and friendliness was terrific, there is nothing I can complain about at all. The breakfast was perfect, location was fantastic. The only thing the villa needed was a mob on the floor instead of just a sweep, but that is nothing. I will defiantly be staying there every year now.

Beautiful property - nestled in the heart of Seminyak but yet has it own privacy. Very friendly & helpful staff. Very convenient & centrally located. Loved the property alot - just a little touch up & refurbishment is required.

I have just returned from Seminyak Suites today and being a very hard marker, simply cannot complain about our stay. We had the two bedroom villa which we found to be extremely comfortable and well appointed. The small maintenance items that were required were mostly attended to at 11pm about half an hour after our arrival and completed when we were out and not inconvenienced. The breakfast was great, the location perfect especially if you are there for shopping and going out. However the main thing that stood out to me after spending a lot of time in hotels and villas all over Asia was the staff. They were simply fabulous. You truly felt welcome and nothing was a problem. I would highly recommend Seminyak Suites to anyone planning a trip to Bali in the Seminyak area.

My family of four, including two teenagers, have just returned back home from an amazing 12 nights spent at this luxurious villa. All the staff were terrific and friendly and who worked tirelessly to make our stay as accommodating as possible. From our clean and spacious rooms serviced daily to the sparkling blue pool, and to the delicious daily breakfast provided, nothing was too much trouble for them. We will return again next year and thoroughly recommend to all that the Seminyak Suites- Private Villas is the perfect place to stay in Seminyak for your Bali getaway and I bet that they will remember all of your names too on your return!

Thank you to the staff at Seminyak Suite Private Villas for an amazing experience. The greetings every morning made you feel welcome and the assistance giving with obtaining local information for locations to visit and other things such as restaurants and getting suites made was great. The villas...well amazing is underselling them. It was so nice to be able to jump into your own private pool when ever. Fantastic for that romantic holiday. Would also recommend visiting the day spa...so relaxing.
105.title: “Changed our impression of Bali”

description: We have just stayed in a two bedroom villa and rate this villa highly.

Friendly staff that remembered all our names throughout our stay and very helpful when wanting to book excursions. The villas are really big, plenty of room for a family of four. They were also exceptionally clean, pool was too as well as just the right temperature. With security personnel 24 hrs we also felt very safe. The location was fantastic......so close to everything in Seminyak was just a short cab or walk away. The breakfast in the restaurant was yummy and my husband and I had eggs freshly cooked each day whilst the kids had pancakes made fresh to order. Overall we had a great experience as we left to go to the Outrigger for a few nights afterwards and regretted it immediately, this villa was far superior for the same money. We actually all got Bali belly at the Outrigger after dining in their restaurant! Well done Seminyak Private Suite on providing a very happy holiday for my family.
We stayed here on a family get together holiday in a 2 bedroom pool villa.

The rooms were super huge - both the bedroom area and the bathrooms. Our room also had an additional single bed placed in the lower room area for our son (15yrs) which was no trouble at all for them. There were air conditioning units in both the bedroom area and seperately in the bathroom which both worked beautifully.

The only fault we had was that during the rainy season the highly polished tiles become VERY slippery - so it is recommended to ask for additional towels or similar to put on the steps so you dont slip and hurt yourself.
The outdoor lounge area was spacious facing the pool and the morning we chose to have breakfast made in the villa was very plentiful with heaps of left overs.
Room service was available at all times and they were happy to deliver. We went to the sister villas for a dinner which was a satay buffet (and live band/group) food and service were great.
Their private spa was amazing; which we visited several times thru out our stay make the most amazing ginger & cinnamon tea which you must try.
The location is fantastic and is close to the Bintang supermarket and the stores in the main streets are a lot more relaxing that those in the heart of Kuta to visit.
The Seminyak Cafe nearby (on the corner of the supermarket) have a great menu and very cheap pricing. Also JP's bar further down is a great place to visit; great food and entertainment.

We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa we are a family of 4. The service from the staff is fabulous Rimini and Aryu were just great with my kids. The villa is just down it's own private lane so cabs can drop you off right at the front door, no wandering down unlit lane ways. The villas are at the Legian end of Seminyak with plenty of great restaurants and shops right at the top of the short lane way. Villas are a great size and very private. Breakfast is a bit limited but you can catch the buggy over the road to their sister resort (for a bit more variety) which is also where there beautiful day spa is. We have already booked for next year.

We stayed in The Seminyak Suites villa during our honeymoon in March 2012 (I'm a little behind in my review!). The villa was well located however we felt it was almost too big for 2 people- it lacked the romantic atmosphere we were after. The bathroom was unnecessarily ridiculously big!! The villa was private however housekeeping and the gardener will appear throughout the day. I think this place is more suited for larger groups or family travel. We also found that the rooms and complex are starting to date a little. I think there are better villas available in Seminyak- we would not stay here again.

We went to Bali for my 40th birthday this year and stayed here from 2nd Jan to 5th Jan 2012. We had booked 5 villas with 2 bedrooms each. It was a wonderful stay with family and friends with our own little pool in each villa. The only disappointment was the check in delay after a long flight from Mumbai. The villas were nice and clean and so were the pools, the villas also have huge bathrooms. The staff is friendly but service is lacking. Ideal location and there are many restaurants as well as soon as you step out. Breakfast is decent with not much variety. for using the spa you need to take the buggy to the adjacent property Estate & Spa. Overall nice, clean and well located villas.
110.title: “Nice villas located in busy Seminyak area and still secluded”

description: Stayed 2 nights with friends in a two bedroom pool villa. Very happy with it. Very friendly staff, good food, very comfy bed, huge bathroom. Breakfast I just nice. Not much variety. I wish I can stay longer.
We've just come home, and are missing yesterday already.
Staying at the Seminyak Suite Private Villas was absolutely wonderful. Having you're own little oasis with private pool was something special.

Sometimes when you see photos on the web when you book, and get nothing like it when you arrive, well the Seminyak Suites were exactly like the photos, and such a relaxing experience for my husband and I.
The staff were friendly, and happy to help, greeting you by name each time they see you.

It's situated just off the main road and very central in Seminyak for shopping, and good restaurants either by foot or short taxi ride. The Bintang supermarket is just a short walk to stock up on drinks, snacks and dodgy gifts. There is no road noise, let alone noise from neighbouring villas.
We're already planning on bringing the kids back to experience this little bit of heaven.

My idea was to escape the hustole of the city life and i got just that and probably more. The vila was nice and clean spacious too. The pool was clean and water is never cold but perfect for such high tempretures in Bali. The staff take time to know your name and never call you sir! they call you by name and are very attentive and ever friendly. I definately will go back any time of the year. No need to try other villas. they say if it aint broken dont fix it. Value for money, the best relaxation i have had in a while. The villa is private so perfect for romance or family bonding. I loved it 5 stars from me. You should try their ribs, "delicious"

We recently stayed at the Seminyak Suite Private Villa in a two bedroom pool villa. The Villa was spacious and clean and in a great location. The king size bedroom was huge and the bathroom was amazingly massive. Only dissappointment with the room was that there weren't any drawers to put clothes away. I like to unpack and not live in a suitcase but there was only a small hanging space and a shelf. Bintang Supermarket next door was handy to buy supplies really cheap. Plenty of Shops and restaurants directly out the front driveway. Breakfast room was small and stuffy so we decided to have breaky delivered to our room the following mornings which was great. Eating in the privacy of your villa by the pool was beautiful. Anything you wanted all included in our Bed and Breakfast price.
The staff were friendly and very helpful, the smiling faces of the front desk staff were a delight ever time we walked into the lobby to collect our keys. Definitely recommend this one.

Firstly I would like to say a big thank you to Rini and the team for making our recent stay special. Everyone who works here is lovely, and will go out of their way to help you. On our first day we did a silly thing and changed money on the side of the road (opposite the villas), of course we were ripped off by about $70 AU each. These guys are magicians! One mention of this to Rini at reception and she had organised the security guard to go with us and our money was handed back no questions asked. We had a 2 bedroom villa with a sparkling clean pool which was the perfect temperature for a swim any time of the day or night. We asked for a room away from the roosters and were put right down the end, and it was peaceful and relaxing. The breakfast was fantastic and don't forget to ask them to make you banana pancakes, yum! Yes, the wood around the pool was coming loose in some places, but nothing to worry about and want affect your stay is this fantastic place. We ate in all the local restaurants around the villa and paid around $10 per head for entree, main and drink. Next time we would give Jimbaran Bay a miss as it was very over priced and the seafood was very poor compared to Aussie seafood. Stick to the local restaurants and you can't go wrong.
115.title: “Fantastic location and beautiful Villa”

description: We were collected from the airport and driven to our accommodation upon arrival the staff
were very attentive helpful and friendly. We were totally rapt with our suite (there was four
of us ) and it was so much bigger and nicer than we anticipated from the pictures and i had
been told that some of the pools in the villas were quite so small so it was a big surprise to
see that ours was a great size. Beautifully maintained, excellent service, room service food
good, breakfast excellent (which was included) there was a free massage per person and a free dinner per person. Throughout our stay the staff could not have been nicer nothing was
too much trouble and everyone from the gardeners, pool staff, waiters and reception staff
all took the time to speak to you and give you one of those fabulous Bali smiles.

We loved the privacy of our room after venturing out into the streets and countryside in the heat it was so nice to just come back to our rooms and chill. There is a supermarket and auto bank machines about 2min away which was fantastic as there is a good size fridge to fill with
Bintang's and Aussie wine ($20 Aussie) There was also a water cooler /hot water in the kitchen
great for a cuppa or cold drink and to make ice blocks. The beds were large and very comfortable and the rooms had two airconditioners one the bedroom and one in the bathroom
(also very large) All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend to anyone.

Delays with room service meals is the only fault we could find otherwise the resort is centrally located to most destinations and the staff are very warm and accommodating. Everyone from the gardener to security and up to reception staffers more than helpful. The restaurant breakfast is exceptional but is sadly lacking for evening meals. Overall a great place to stay with an affordable price.

I travelled to Bali for the first time with my sister and wanted to stay somewhere that offered a private pool (pristinely maintained), spacious accommodation and facilities (tick and tick), decent sized fridge (tick), excellent bed (tick) and clean (superbly done by the housekeeping, pool and garden staff). Our experience was just wonderful from the time we arrived to our departure on day 9. Breakfast was included as was an hour's massage and one dinner. The massage was awesome, but we didnt make it to the dinner. We did however order light lunch on arrival but it was very average so decided that we wouldnt order again. Every other aspect of our stay was great and recommend Seminyak Suite to anyone.

I was actually excited to stay at this hotel while transiting Bali on my way for business to another area of Indonesia. When my trip was canceled, the hotel gave me a huge hassle about the room. Be very, very careful. They charge you huge fees up front, and regardless of how far in advance you cancel, they want to charge you for THE ENTIRE ROOM. If you think, for even a moment, that you might have to move your plans, forget this hotel. Delayed flight? Good luck. Flooding? Forget it. Family emergency? Bonne chance. I wish I had the opportunity to comment on the hotel and the staff, but I will be bypassing this resort on my next transit through the country. It's just too much of a hassle.
We had the misfortune to stay here earlier this year. Having travelled a great deal, this is by far the worst ever hotel we've stayed and cut our stay sjhort (we've never done that before).

We arrived at a fairly nice reception and were shown to our villa full of anticipation. However, when we arrived it was run down, wooden planks raised around the pool, leaking air conditioner and blood drops around the pool (very worrying!). Despite promising a secluded, quiet experience, the ghetto blasters in the room opposite us was being used by a group of drunk lads and the whole experience reminded us of a cheap motel rather than a £130+ hotel! We asked to move, and they showed us another of their drab hotels which was worst than Seminyak Suites.

We decided to leave and find another hotel. We asked for a refund of our money (having checked in a few hours earlier) and were told that the cancellation policy was 100% fee. They are a private hotel and set their own rules, but the owners refused to refund a cent despite staying in the hotel for less than 4 hours.

Beware, if you have the slightest inkling that this hotel wont be right for you, dont even try to book or at very least see the room before checking in. The owners took our 100% fee (we booked through Agoda) which was just under £1k. We found another hotel and enjoyed the rest of our holiday.
120.title: “Without doubt the worst hotel in Bali...appauling throughout”

description: We had a two bedroom villa for a week in early June. The staff are absolutely wonderful, the rooms are very spacious and clean. As we were travelling with children we requested a pool fence, which was in place by the time we arrived. The only fault we could find with this villa is that the service was somewhat hit and miss. The breakfast menu although not extensive was certainly fresh and plentiful. The location of these villas are perfect! Far enough away to mute the road noise, yet close enough to walk to one of the many delicious cafe's. This was our third family trip to Bali and each time have stayed in villa's. Although this was not the best villa, it was certainly right up there. Once the service issues have been addressed I believe they will provide stiff competetion for nearby 5 star villas. Would we stay here again with our family? The answer is a resounding yes.

We stayed for 11 nights in the 2 bdrm villa. Everyone from reception staff to cleaners and gardeners were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was wonderful and food was fresh and very tasty. The villa was exactly as advertised, spacious comfortable and the bathrooms were huge with a bath that would fit the whole family in it. Water was always hot. The pool was big enough for a few laps and always clean. We really enjoyed the tranquility of the complex as it can get a little hectic outside and security at 2 points made you feel very secure.Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, when we arrived we were tired but by the time we left we felt relaxed and did not wanto leave. If you are looking for a place to rejuvenate this is definatley the place.
We were upgraded from their sister suite, wow, we were not disappointed, this place was great.
Our own pool, two HUGE bedrooms and the bathroom was beautiful.
7 nights and loved it.
The reception ladies were extremely nice, they knew us by name and would make an effort to come out and greet us when returning from our outings.
Spa treatment was good.

One thing I would suggest, DO NOT eat at the restaurant for dinner, it's at their sister suite and the food was horrible, we had to go out after to get a proper feed. We went on the night recommended by the staff (roast night) and was told its the most popular night so boom early, one other group there with us. The music was good during dinner. Watch out for alcohol costs as well, very expensive.
Overall the rooms are amazing, I would not hesitate to stay there again or recommend.
They will also put a fence around your pool if you have small children.
Great stay
Stayed in the villa for our honeymoon for 1 week.
Very well looked after. Very spacious room and your own lap pool.
Great if you like to be left alone and not disturbed as you can lock your front
door and not have to see anyone if preferred!!!!

We stayed here for 10 nights in early June 2012, and from the moment we arrived we knew we had made an excellent choice. Reception was so welcoming & check in was easy . Ari was fantastic and she remembered our names ( all 8 of us ! ) after a day.
The bedrooms are amazing, as is the bathroom , very spacious , big bed and Air con that works efficiently & silently.

We were in Villa 7 , a 2 bedroom villa that has a sunken area & lounge in each bedroom so you can watch TV . My sister and her family were in Villa 8 , and their rooms had the TV mounted opposite the bed so you can watch in luxury. we found there was too much to do ,so apart from some highlights of AFL games & Euro 2012 we didnt watch TV much.

A short walk up the laneway and you are straight on the main st , BMC money changer across the street gave a slightly higher exchange rate than the official currency market ( which I checked daily on the free Wi-Fi ). Bintang supermarket is nice and close , as are some wonderful places to grab a meal ( separate reviews to follow)
Out door living area was great , we could sit and have a drink and relax whilst watching the kids in the pool ( saw some lizards and Bats at night ) and the two sunbeds were put to good use as well .
Villas were cleaned daily , along with fresh sheets & towels provided , and the pool cleaned and water quality checked every morning.

Breakfast was exceptional , a great variety to choose from , with Eggs, Omelettes and pancakes made upon request. We counted approx over 40 individual different servings of food so you are spoilt for choice .
So overall it is a GREAT place to stay , service by the attentive staff exceeded all our expectations , brilliant location, we willl be back !!!!!!!
125.title: “Sensational ! I want to live here !”

description: I stayed in a 3 bedroom villa with friends just recently for 1 week and we all loved it. We loved the outdoor living/kitchen area and the big private pool we had all to ourselves. All the bedrooms were large and each with its own ensuite bigger then you could imagine.
The location was perfect with just a 1min walk to bintang supermarket and a short walk to garlic lane.
All the staff were amazing and extremely helpful and friendly.
I would stay there again in a heart beat.

Checked into a 2 bedroom villa. There were 2 large bedrooms with a king sized bed in each. Huge bathrooms too with sunken bath and separate showers. Well maintained. Not the fanciful new age hotel type but sort of rustic and homely. Besides some construction noise nearby, the place is quiet and tranquil. The pool wasn't huge but more than adequate for some good family fun. It's 1.5m deep throughout so be mindful with your kids. A long private alley leads to the villa entrance from the main road in Seminyak. The main road is a bustling 2 lane road with shops and boutiques all over. But once you walked into the alley, tranquility returns. Kinda ironic but charming!

So, I have read a few of the negative reviews, and to me, it does not seem like the same place!! I have just come home from a 5 day trip to The Seminyak Suite for my best friends bachelors weekend. From the moment we got to the property, we were greeted by every staff that they had on the property, from the security guard at the top of the drive way to the one at the bottom, then to the lovely concierge staff at reception. As someone who used to train people in customer service, this place had already won in my books.

We were shown to our room, and was amazed at how big and immaculate the place was. Everything was clean and tidy, the rooms were MASSIVE as well as the bathrooms, which could have easily have had its own swimming pools in all of them. They were HUGE. We had clean towels, clean sheets every day.

We had the breakfast option every morning, which we enjoyed everything that was there. I don't understand why people would complain about breakfast... we loved it!! The staff in the restaurant were great as well.

Everything we requested, they organised, even a late check out on our last day as well as dinner at their sister villa where the placed us at their prime-position table for their traditional Balinese dance performance. We couldn't stay for the whole thing, because of our flights, but we were very impressed and very grateful.

One of the big things for myself, personally, was that I had an accident on a scooter, where I came off it up at the top of their busy street. I had everyone from the villa to help me and make sure I was ok. I was most impressed with my new friend from reception, Ayu, who not only helped clean up my wounds, she was genuinely upset at my fall.

Every one remembered our names and said hello and good bye to us, and even gave us some Indonesian lessons. They really did go above and beyond what I believed they should have done, and we could not have asked for a better time.
Thank you so much for the last 5 days. We will tell all our friends about you guys and I can't wait to return and spend more time with you!!
Amazing villas located off the main road which gives it the ideal location. Its brilliantly secluded away from the hustle and bustle to give you the privacy which one wants on holiday.

The villas are brilliantly spaceious, the pool is cleaned daily, all members of staff are friendly especially the main reception staff who always take time to talk to you, even getting up and coming to the front of the reception to say hello as you walk past.

One thing which can be improved upon is the size of the TV and where they are located. From the bed, its difficult to watch TV, it could do with a flexible wall stand which would allow you to watch it when lying down, or sitting on the sofas.

Staff are so accomendating that when asked if the football would be shown (champions League Final), that I was informed its not currently tuned into the rooms, but a member of staff will come round and tune the TV so that I would be able to watch it. Nothing was too difficult for them to do.
Would definately recommend staying here again.
My husband and I had a great break without the kids.
The location was perfect, with lots of restaurants, shops close by. But the villas were very quiet despite being close to busy road.
The villa itself was MAGIC!! We had a two bedroom villa with just the two of us.

The bed and pillows were very comfortable - the bathroom enormous and the bath HUGE - plenty of room for two adults. The pool was always clean and perfect temperature, and it was great to have the stereo with Ipod connection to listen to our music while relaxing by the pool. Having a medium sized fridge where we could keep our drinks and snacks was great, as was the filtered water with hot and cold on tap. We didn't go to watch tv, but did laze with a book or googled on the Ipad. Wifi was good most of the time and as fast as home.
The staff were very helpful, courteous and discrete - there when you needed them. The gardens and grounds were just beautiful and our walk to the very end villa was lovely.
Breakfasts were delicious, with all tastes catered for. I loved the Balinese cakes and the black rice in coconut.
We will be back again - perfect place for a perfect break!!
130.title: “Perfect”

description: Stayed 10 nights at the beginning of may with 3 girlfriends and my experience was amazing the staff are 10/10 especially at the front desk they are always friendly even at 1 in the morning!

the bathrooms are huge and air conditioning in all rooms even bathrooms,pool is cleaned everyday and always at the perfect temperature. The lounge room section with the kitchen is outside so when we all wanted to relax together and watch t.v we had to go into the rooms? the location is right in the middle of all the shops in seminyak it was the perfect quietest location for how close it was to everything and with security guards along the driveway made it easy to cross the road. The breakfast is a traditional balinese buffet breakfast and they also make to order pancakes,eggs and omlettes,fruit,toast,yoghurt and oats,bacon,sausages and people who complain about the food need to realize they are in another country so of course the food is going to taste different! the bin tang market is a few doors down to pick up supplies,proper money changer and atms across the road and the Greek restaurant out the front has generous servings and delicious! i will definitely be staying there again!

My husband and I stayed at the Seminyak Suites for 7nts and we LOVED OUR VILLA!! We stayed in a 2 BR villa, room 209 to be exact. From the moment we drove down the long narrow alley to the front office, we were impressed. The service we received is unmatched by any other facility I have ever encountered. Everyone from the security guards to the groundskeepers are super friendly. The front desk staff took an active interest in our comings/goings on a daily basis. The grounds are impeccably maintained. You could not ask for a more perfect location than what you get with the Seminyak Suites. It is located close to plenty of retail shopping, bars, spas, restaurants, a pharmacy, and 24hr convenience stores. We were a 50 cent cab ride away from Jalan Double Six-which took us to beach front bars and restaurants.

The villa we stayed in contained an enormous outdoor sitting area, dining room table, bar, and kitchen. All of this faced the beautiful, CLEAN, private pool. Our villa was surrounded by 10-12 ft high walls so we didn't worry about any peeping toms. The bedroom was large and we liked the decor-contemporary. The bathroom was HUGE! My voice actually echoed in it! The bathtub is about 5-6 ft long and wide enough for 2 adults. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and were so sad to leave. The Seminyak Suites are a wonderful find!

Very good staff , do anything for you, the Villa's themselve need a bit of work very tied looking, the tv was small and you couldn't watch it from the bed , the breakfast was cold , so ended up going outfor breakfast , the pool was the best feature

This is the second time that my partner and I have stayed at the Seminyak Suites. We enjoyed a one bedroom villa, which has it's own private pool, outdoor living and dining facilities. I'd thoroughly recommend a stay at the villas if you enjoy being in the middle of Seminyak, close to the Bintang supermarket, top restaurants, and international quality shopping.
From the moment we arrived until the moment we reluctantly left, we were in paradise. We shared a two bedroom villa with another couple - perfect!
The pool was fantastic. We purchased 2 lilos from Bintang supermarket which we shared upon our departure with another family. $4.00 well spent.

The breakfast was great, coffee nearly there but the service was amazing!! Ayu and Rindi couldn't do enough for you. They knew your name from the second day, always said hello. They were interested in what you were doing etc. I gave Ayu a list of tours, restaurant bookings, tailor and leather requirements etc. Ayu returned my list with confirmation bookings and appointments for tailor and leather to come to the apartments - was just too easy.
The security staff always welcomed us with a hello, nod of the head etc.
Absolute pleasure to stay - soooooo quiet. We will be back!
135.title: “WOW!”

description: We had a wonderful stay and will definitely be back with the kids. The staff are amazing and we loved the location! The room size and the pool took my breath away. The breaky is basic but ample. Could never go back to a hotel after staying at this place!

The staff were very responsive, they brought us a fan, sorted out the wi'fi, cleaned the pool - shame we had to ask for these things I guess, but they were dealt with as soon as we did. They also let us check out a little late - which was really appreciated. There's a bit of noise from the neighbouring villas (if you're unlucky to be next to a young family or someone with bad /thumping taste in music), but the bathrooms are fabulous, and the beds are comfy; breakfast is a good spread too.

Not only nice place for family or romantic couple, but also good service and tell you what ! I left my Laptop charger during my stay in the Seminyak Suite Villa, and when I realized it, I was already thousand miles away. And yet, the management of the Villa sent the charger by courier to me Free of Charge !
Thank you for your amazing Care and good service as well as good place to enjoy serenity life ! with good surrounding shopping places of Kuta Bali,.
From the time we arrived we have been treated like royalty. We are a stones throw away from bartering stalls and boutique shops, so great shopping for all members of the family.

The Villa is very spacious and comfortable. The teenage children can access wifi all the time as the parents can relax in the outside kitchen area beside the pool. Each day the rooms are cleaned and the villas maintained. The staff have a friendly smile and a cheerful good morning. Dining out is easy and affordable in Seminyak, plenty of cafes and not far from Seminyak Square which is very popular with a multitude of international dining to choose from. You can also go for the option of room service. Cheap and varied menus for all the family. The staff are very helpful and fullill your request promptly and have great recommendations for touristy activities during our your stay.
Every one we have spoken to have been pleased with their choice of staying at the Seminyak Suite. We recommend it to all for a worry free stay.

My partner & I recently went on our honeymoon in Bali. We stayed 6 nights here, then 6 nights at the Kunja. In comparison, the Kunja was a nicer villa, however this place was still very pleasent. The pool was nice and big, the staff were absolutely brilliant, air con in the bedroom and a fairly decent size outside area by the pool with small kitchen, table and a couple of lounge chairs. The bathroom was also very big and functional. It's situated right next to Bintang supermarket, and just off the main drag, but you couldn't actually hear the traffic or anything. As mentioned in some other reviews, next door to the suites is a place where they keep a heap of roosters (we asked the villa, and unfortunately they said they're used for illegal fighting matches), and although you never see them, you can hear them (in saying that, it didn't actually bother us at all, they just chatter amongst themselves in the morniing). There is breakfast included, which you can get in the villa or in the restaurant. The food was "ok" (not fantastic, not horrible). But really, my partner thought the whole villa was fantastic, as he's never been in Asia or stayed in a villa before (which I have, so perhaps I've just been a bit spoilt for choice over the years!). But again - the staff were great, and it's a good spot to kick back if it's your first time staying in a private villa.
140.title: “Pretty good if you're after a villa but don't want to spend too much”

description: We stayed in a one bed villa. The location is great and being set back from the road is very quiet. The walk into the villa area is lovely. The villa is a good size and layout but ours was very tired and faded but it was comfortable. A refurbishment and repaint with a good interior designer would make a big difference. Our villa was painted a blue/grey colour which belongs in a prison or hospital - really not a nice colour. The furnishings are comfortable but faded. The king bed was comfy and the bathroom was huge - shower was okay and there was a big sunken bath.Would have loved a fan in the outside area as at times it was stuffy. I did ask for a fan but it never eventuated. Air conditioning was good but our bedroom air conditioner was very noisy. Breakfast is in a stuffy room upstairs with terrible background music but the buffet food was adequate. The staff are lovely and everything is kept clean. I had expected more as we stay in villas often - but would not stay again unless it was refurbished.

We had a 3 villa room with 3 rollaway beds to fit 9 ladies. The pictures really do show what the villa's are about. Rooms are very clean, we had a bit water issues being the rainy season on the common area which although is under cover still had water on the floor. The housekeeping staff were very quick to help clean it up. The kitchen, although small is perfect to organise a quick snack and a bite to eat. The King size beds are huge and very comfortable to sleep in.

The staff and Rini are excellent, so warm, friendly and always smiling. Breakfast was good in a boutique style manner. There was always a chef to cook your eggs anyway you like it, considering it consists of only a few villa's the breakfast area was never too loud or crowded.
It is conveniently located in Seminyak. There's enough spa's, shops and even the local supermarket (bintang) to pick up supplies within walking distance.
I will definately go back there again next time !

we stayed 10 days 27/02-07/03 ( being 5 two couples and a teenager) in a two room villa and there is not one thing i can fault about this place..the staff are great they never once forgot our names and would meet us with smiles and conversation... room service is promt and very good..house keeping is amazing they never once intruded .... if there is anything on a VERY minor negative is that the tiles in the outdoor living area get very slipery when you get out of the pool ( a piece of outdoor carpet would fix this) but that is very minor... also a can of insect repelent given to guests in the afternoon to do their own rooms at their own lesure,but once again this is very minor....thank you to all the staff ( Rini you are a beautiful lady ) for making our first trip to Bali one to remember.
The staff here couldn't be more helpful or friendly. Nothing was too much trouble.
The villas are pretty much as per the pictures on their website although it is looking a little tired.
The pool tiles need scrubbing & the outside of the villa could do with a paint to return it's "as new" feel.
Apart from that it was a wonderful stay. The service was outstanding and we got upgraded to a 2 bedroom villa for no additional cost.

The only suggestions I would make would be for them to have a small table outside with the lounges with an umbrella as it gets damn hot in full sun sitting there. Also we had to ask for a fan just to sit outside. They very kindly gave us the one from reception to use our entire stay.
The bed was awesome but with the TV facing the lounge in the bedroom it made it a little difficult to watch TV from bed. Not a big deal - but just something to mention.
It was my boyfriend's birthday while we were away & they gave him a birthday cake for free which was pretty damn good! :)
All in all they were incredibly friendly & warm.

I stayed here for a week of relaxing and partying with a large group of friends & family. We had a mix of two and three bedroom villas, each with a private pool. Please note the hotel has a sister property, the Villa Seminyak Estate & Spa – located across the road, further up Jalan Raya Seminyak road.

We were thoroughly impressed with the grounds on check-in and when shown to our villas. The layout of each villa is perfect: individual rooms with ensuite, with an adjoining outdoor area, overlooking the plunge pool, surrounded by tall walls ensuring maximum privacy. The rooms were splendid: the lower area had the flat screen TV & DVD unit, room safe, and a pretty but very uncomfortable love seat (a couple of cushions on a marble frame isn’t snug). The upper area had either two king single beds or a large king size bed (watch out for the marble bed bases, protruding further than the mattresses!), with crisp, white linen and a number of luxurious pillows with two bedside tables. A number of power points are available for charging devices. The main glass French doors to the room, when locked, could still allow mosquitoes in through, so beware. There are no screens on doors and windows are unable to be opened. A small alcove leading to the bathroom has the open air wardrobe, complete with robes and slippers. Pool towels are stored & replenished here. Then enter the most spacious bathroom I have ever seen: a corner shower area with large rainwater style head, screened by strategically placed wall, with recess shelving, a huge bath (which we didn’t utilise due to poor water pressure – it would have taken days to fill the bath), a large vanity and toilet recess. Somehow, mosquitoes made it into the bathroom – not sure how?! Towels, face washers and hand towels are supplied, as too a multitude of toiletries. Air conditioning systems in the rooms & bathrooms were individually controlled.

Outside, the common area consisted of a lounge and iPOD dock/CD music player, dining suite and small kitchenette: small fridge (just make sure it is set to the coolest setting), sink & small number of kitchenware. No fans are outside. Mosquito repellent spray bottles are provided, as too coils. Every evening, the villas are sprayed by the staff for mosquitoes. Almost every night I was bitten by mosquitoes – not pleasant. The main feature of the villa is the plunge pool at the centre the common area & rooms – a beautifully blue tiled pool with sun lounge chairs, deck chairs and palms: truly idyllic!

Flooring throughout the villa is marble – a major slip hazard when wet! Tap water in Bali is not drinkable, but the villas supply bottled water every day. I had full mobile phone reception and complimentary wifi is provided. I am unsure if a laundry service is provided. I did my laundry in the bathroom sink & some friends/family sent their laundry to be done on the main street Laundromat. A fully cooked breakfast buffet is provided daily in the restaurant upstairs of the main reception building. It is open air, so beware the mosquitoes & other bugs. It is slightly air conditioned and ceiling fans are in use. A complimentary dinner is also included, which was disappointing. Each guest staying at the villa was entitled to a complimentary one-hour body massage, provided at the spa at the hotel’s other property. Guests are transported by golf cart.

Although the villas are located down a long driveway off the main street (Jalan Raya Seminyak), you cannot hear the hustle and bustle at all. So it is an oasis among all the amenities you could want: restaurants, the Bintang shopping centre, market stalls, money changers, transport (taxi or scooter). The best set of bars & restaurants are located not too far, on Jalan Double Six street, overlooking the beach. Kuta & Legian are 10-15min drives away. There is so much to do, but I would highly recommend a day trip to either the Bali Hai pontoon or to Lembongan Island: great drift dives whilst being child/family friendly & entertaining.
145.title: “absolute sanctuary”

description: The villas were absolutely amazing, clean, comfortable and well air conditioned. The bathroom was amazing, the pool was quite larger than what i was expecting. The staff were extremely friendly. The only issues we had were there were power outs almost everyday, and a struggle with internet connection. The breakfasts were ok, but the free dinner for two we received with our package was very very ordinary along with the free one hr massage we also got included in our packages. But these were minor issues in comparison to the villas themselves and the staff. Overall i would highly recommend staying at the seminyak suites, it is walking distance to great restaurants and shopping. Next time I would just not bother wasting my time on a massage or the hotels dinner. But would defiantly stay again!

The staff were fantastic, always smiling and wishing you hello. Rooms were clean. One of the toilets did not flush very well nor did the bath empty well compared to the 206. But it was not a major problem. The idea of having your own private pool to dip into at your leisure was fabulous.

Putu was a great receptionist. How does she remember all our names? Never failed to smile or welcome us back to the suites. Even the gardener and security guards, both at the top of property and at the gate always smiled and said hello. It was a great trip and the amenities were lovely. When there was a fire in the kitchen, the staff transported us to the other resort for our breakfast without any hesitation. Massage was relaxing and the food was tasty but needs to be served hot.
I recently had a stay at Seminyak Suites and absolutely loved it.
I am a travel agent with Flight Centre so I have a high expectation of accommodation.
I absolutely loved this property and could not have asked for a better holiday.
I loved that the villas really did look like they do in the pictures.
The pool was quite large and the bedrooms were spectacular. We loved the sunken baths and the choice of having breakfast cooked for us in our villa if we didn't want to go to buffet.
The staff were amazing and really made our first time to Bali a winner. We will definitely be back to stay again :)

The main street running from Kuta/Legian through Seminyak and up to Kerobokan is Jalan Raya Seminyak. It is alive with motorcycles, cars, pedestrian shoppers, Balinese going about their daily lives, stores and businesses. If you turn down a particular driveway going off that street you will find yourself at the reception of The Seminyak Suites, and in a different world altogether.

Once you have checked in, you walk down a paved walkway bordered by frangipanis, heliconias, gingers and other tropical plants. The doors to each individual villa compound open off that walkway. The complex seems to be surrounded by traditional Balinese houses and activities. You can hear the odd rooster crowing, but not much else. Certainly no traffic noise.

We stayed in a two-bedroom villa. If anything, it looked better than the photos on the website. Each bedroom wing is huge - with a sunken lounge, kingsize bed and enormous ensuite. The airconditioning is effective. The shared kitchen/lounge area is smallish but adequate, and opens directly onto the private pool. The service was unobtrusive and brilliant. Staff were lovely. Security was tight but comforting.

The location is excellent. The Bintang Supermarket is 100 metres up the road. It is an easy walk to Jalan Abimanyu and the bars and restaurants. Made's Warung II is practically across the road. It is a longer walk - or a $2 cab ride - to Jalan Oberoi, Ku De Ta, etc. To our surprise - we haven't been for 25 years - Bali now has world class restaurants. The pick is La Lucciola.

Great service and beautiful villas at The Seminyak Suite Private Villa. The spacious rooms and the big private pool are great - one could spend the whole vacation inside the property. A few steps from the villas are many restaurants and shops, and at night, many bars and clubs are in walking distance too. A quick bike or taxi ride away is the beach. We had a great vacation here.
150.title: “Beautiful & quiet villa near shopping & nightlife”

description: Thanks so much to the staff at The Seminyak Suite's , we had the most amazing time. The Villa's are such a relaxing place to come back to after a long hot day shopping and touring, it was so great to have the private villa with modern facilitys. The staff are so amazing , they really went over and beyond for us and welcomed us everytime we came home , offered advise everytime we went out and smiles everyday. The breakfast was cooked for us in the room and was such a nice touch also , we also had spa tretments and was so amazing and relazing also. I am a travel agent and see alot of hotels and this is truly one on the best !! Thanks again

We were bowled over by the place... we walked in the front door and were overwhelmed by the beauty and space. The villas are very Clean, efficient, luxurious, friendly and most of all.... SAFE. I just want to tell everyone what a terrific stay we had last week at The Seminyak Suite, Bali for my 50th Birthday,A group of 6 friends enjoyed a fantastic 4 days, pure relaxation!!! i even received a birthday cake at 9pm when we returned from our long day out sight seeing, All in all, the staff had done their jobs well and this was reflected in the level of attention to detail and the attitude of the staff was impeccable, We were treated like royalty . The staff were very friendly, hospitable and nothing was too hard for them to do. I can't write enough about how great our stay was there. It is an amazing place, and i will be back with my husband. Thank you all staff you made my birthday a very special time.

My husband and I stayed in a 1 bedroom villa for 5 days. What a fantastic place, the villas were within walking distance to restaurants, spas and plenty of shops.The villas are large and very quiet and have everything you need in them. The private pool was awesome just what we needed with the hot weather.
The staff are very friendly and helpful. It was great to get up everyday and be greeted with a "Good Morning and a Smile". Would definately recommend this place to anyone.
In September 2011 our family including 3 children stayed in a Seminyak Suite private villa.
The whole experience was awesome! It was so relaxing and wished we could stay longer.

The location of the Seminyak Suites is in a great location near resturants, shops and shoppping market, yet tucked back off the road and was incredibly quiet! The gardens are beautifully and the whole place is very, very clean!
The staff from the monment you arrived were very friendly and helpful.
We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa with 3 children, private pool and it was huge, plently of room.
We will definitively be staying there again with or without the children next time!
Totally recommend this accomodation!

What an awesome place. My husband and I stayed in a Grand Deluxe villa and it was sensational. Very clean and the staff were so friendly and easy to talk to. Nothing was an issue. Will go back there for sure!
155.title: “Fantastic!”

description: Stayed 10 nights and enjoyed every minute. great location walking distance to everything wonderful staff
i cant say enough about the place
pool was a hit swimming whenever we wanted room service was great
thank you for the great memories
The breakfast buffet should be better. The staff was very friendly.

We were a large group of family members, we had 1 single villa and 2 x 2 bedroom villas, so in total our numbers were 11. We had a fantastic time at Seminyak suites, the staff were lovely and were very helpful. Location great. Surroundings beautiful. We would of like to have a TV and more seats/couches in the living area of the villa as we would all get together in the afternoon for a drink and a chat. The pool was fantastic and well maintained. Would certainly stay there again.....

We were a group of 12 people, 2 x 3 bedroom villas, and the staff could not have been more attentive and helpful. Always ready with a hello and keen to ask about our day, where we'd been etc. The villas were very well appointed with plenty of room for 6 adults to be together and to each have their own space. The location was great - right in the heart of shopping strips and plenty of restaurants within walking distance - great coffee at Cafe Seminyak! Bintang Supermarket was just up the street and had EVERYTHING! The beach was a bit of a distance, about 10 mins walk down Double 66 so always lots of shopping on the way! All the staff were fantastic, from the front desk to the gardeners to the security guards, always ready with a hello and a smile, but special mention to Putu and Novi who both went above and beyond to help us find restaurants etc to seat all 12 of us, beautiful inside and out - thank you ladies! I would not hesitate to recommend these villas to anyone and will hopefully return soon!

We were a family of 5 (kids 14, 12, 9) and this type of accommodation really catered for our needs. We stayed in a 2 bdrm royal villa, plenty of room for the kids and the enjoyment of having our own very large pool within our villa. The staff were exceptional, our sincere thanks to all of them, special mention to Dwi & Rinni for looking after us all. The location is certainly very central to the Seminyak shopping district and the in house buggy within the complex can save you walking down to Legian St. Once on Legian St you have at your doorstep the Bintang Supermarket & a 24hr Chemist, a laundry service is also located on Nakula St just behind the reception area. The Spa provided a wonderful service for both myself & children, I will agree it is on the more expensive side, but certainly well worth the experience. Breakfast is not varied and has fairly limited options, but always enjoyable, go for the egg & pancake station which is offered daily. To get to double six road for great family restaurants it costs anywhere between 7500 -10,000 rp...about $1.00 in a metered taxi. The hotel is not in easy walking distance to the beach with kids but it is really nice to come back to your villa and escape the hustle & bustle. Would highly recommend and will certainly re-visit. Thanks for a wonderful stay.
160.title: “Great location, staff & villa accommodation”

description: We thoroughly enjoyed our 9 days here.
Far enough away from party central but close enough if you wanted some time.
My sister LOVED the sunken bath and the pool was clean and an addition we were most grateful for with the gorgeous weather.
The only thing I wasn't fond of was how the TV couldn't be seen from the bed which would have been handy but not a biggy in the scheme of things at all.
Would recommend staying here for sure!

Travelled with a group of 7 and we had a 1 bedroom & 3 bedroom villa and were amazed with the look and even more by the staff. we had a fantastic holiday and it was pure paradise and cannot wait to go back.
Location was fantastic and ver close to all amenities but no right on street and therefor not disturbed by the contact traffic.
Cannot wait to go back just for the Villa and staff!!!!

We were recommended to stay here by a friend and couldn't have been happier. Two mums, no kids, no husbands, just peace and tranquility with the bonus of our private pool. We booked the two bedroom villas but were given the three bedroom on arrival. We were over the moon with the outdoor living area, kitchen (small but functional) and our rooms/bathrooms were just amazing and the stero was a really nice bonus for playing CD's while we were swimming ! You don't think about having a bath on your Bali holiday, but these bathrooms and sunken baths made us change our minds pretty quickly !! The location is great being so close to the Bintang supermarket just up the street. We were able to stock up on whatever we needed (there isn't anything that place doesn't sell) and were close to some really nice restaurants in both Seminyak and a short taxi (or longer walk) to the beach front restaurants in Legian. The staff were great, really friendly and couldn't be happier to do more for you. The food was great and there was always plenty of it. Breakfast can be cooked in your room or up in the restaurant. The only downside to staying up the front of the complex (we were in rooms 111/211 & 311) were the foul next door. They were very active and woke early each day but we only heard them when we were out of our rooms, if you were inside with the door shut, you couldn't hear a thing. Even though we got used to the crowing, it all changed when we moved down to the two bedroom villa for our extra couple of days (we didn't want to leave so stayed for 2 more nights). The only noise we heard then was other guests swimming in their pool and maybe some music, certainly nothing to complain about though. The beds were great, the TV and DVD players in each room was great for checking out the quality of a new release. The spa was lovely, but a little on the expensive side. We were able to get the same treatments/massages etc from another spa in Legian for 1/4 of the price. Also there were mosquitos in the bathrooms each night, the staff come in an spray and as long as you leave your bedroom door shut their nightly spray seems to do the trick along with the plug in device in the bathrooms. All in all I would highly recommend this as a place to stay if you want to get away from it all and bask in some serenity, but still be close enough to the hussell and bussell if you felt like it.

Our stay at The Seminyak Suite Private Villa was amazing. The vills are located in the heart of Seminyak within walking distance for shopping, eating and a large grocery store. When you are in your villa, it is quite and peaceful - you do not hear any of the bustle from the main road. All the staff were very friendly and attentive. We had breakfast cooked in our villa every morning by the delightful staff. The private pools are a wonderful addition to each villa - very clean and refreshing. I would highly recommend this place to all and would come back again.

I stayed here with 3 friends recently and really enjoyed it. We stayed in one of the three bedroom villas. It was huge with a large dining/common area, a private pool and a small but functional kitchen. The rooms were great, with very comfortable king size beds, air-conditioning, a TV in each room and huge bathrooms. The rooms were very clean and well maintained.
Overall the service was really good. The people there were very friendly and helpful when we needed help. The breakfast buffet was a little small but had all your really needed.
we also thought the location was good. It's right in the heart of Seminyak with all the hustle and bustle, but the Suites are down a long driveway so are very quiet.
I'd definitely recommend staying here.
165.title: “Great place to stay”

description: This was not our first trip to Bali. We stayed here for ten nights on the recommendation of a friend. It more than met our expectations. It is an oasis of peace and tranquillity in Seminyak. The staff were friendly, helpful and charming - always smiling and welcoming and very quick to sort out any problems. We had a disaster with the shower which was literally spraying the walls but one phonecall and the plumber was there in about ten minutes. We booked a one bedroom villa and were given a two bedroom villa (with the second room locked) which meant we had so much space and a larger pool. Other reviews say how big the rooms are and they are right. Our villa was serviced every day by a lovely man who kept it spotless. The pool men came each morning and we had visits from the gardener to keep the plants under control. In the evening someone came to spray the bedroom for mossies and to light the mossie coil in the living area - you really did not need to lift a finger. I simply do not understand the bad review below - doesn't sound like the same place. The breakfast could be cooked for you in your villa each mornng or you could eat in the restaurant. We did both and our only complaint was "too much food"! We didn't have dinner there - the Villas are in such a great location that you can reach many restaurants in the area. Try Pearl - it's a real gem! The beach was a fifteen minute walk - or by taxi about five minutes but that depends on the traffic. We had no issue with the cockerels who were most definitely there - we were well into the complex (villa 207) If I must give a negative then it's time the bathroom towels were replaced - they are not at their best. We really enjoyed our time there and would not hesitate to recommend it.

We have stayed here five times in the last two years and love it! I had read the bad reviews and agree with Dewi that I think people are confusing this hotel with others. Service is awesome, fresh linen daily and always clean. Pool is clean and cool. It is our second home thanks to our friends here Budi, Putu, Rini, Ratna and everyone else! Thanks guys for a wonderful holiday.

We loved every moment at the villas we had the 2 bedroom villa and the staff bent over backwards to help us. The rooms were a great size with a massive bathroom, the kitchen had filtered hot and cold water ,our room was cleaned daily, the breakfast was great with a choice of bacon and eggs to indonesian style breakfast. Great location close walk to grocery store for bread, milk, nappies, fruit etc... and great shopping and cheap restaurants, we loved Cafe Seminyak where you can get indonesian cusine or have a pie or hamburger and chips ! will be back missing the staff and the villa already !
Being Balinese the service was excellent, friendly and always helpful.
The suite was very generously sized meaning the minimal wardrobe space and lack of drawers was inexplicable. The private pool and living area were very pleasant.
The restaurant served an acceptable breakfast but our one evening meal (included as a freebie in our package) was sub-standard.

The property is located down a driveway off the busy Seminyak shopping strip but is very quiet. Every suite has its own private pool, which is handy because it is a long walk to the not particularly attractive beach. However taxis are ridiculously cheap.
A significant negative for the property is the seeming absence of quality restaurants in the area.

Perhaps its because this is not the 1st villa we've stayed in Bali, hence the huge disappointment when it came to the villa and service staff. The villa structure is lousy, there's no linkage or roof linking the kitchen to the bedroom, hence if it rains and you need a glass of water, sorry but you gotta dash through the rain to get to the water coz the water dispenser and fridge are at the disconnected kitchen. Lousy ambience. In comparison to the last villa we stayed in, there's no cd player at the kitchen/pool area and there's no lights in the private pool at night. The last villa we stayed in offered in-villa breakfast, meaning every morning you get a cook who will come into your villa just to cook breakfast for you. Seminyak Suite serves breakfast in their hotel restaurant which offers a very limited selection of food with lots of fruit flies to accompany your bread and fruits. Again, back to the last villa we stayed in, service staff took our order to get dinner from nearby restaurants as we didn't want to order from room service but here at Seminyak Suites, its a downright NO, 'Sorry but we are just understaffed' was the excuse we get. Bottom line, for over USD200 per night, its simply not worth it. Better save it for any other nicer villas which are in abundance in Bali.
170.title: “Disappointing, won't come back again”

description: We stayed at the Seminyak Suites for 3 nights with our children aged 7 and 5. We found the rooms to be very spacious and well presented. We loved having our own pool and two bedrooms and bathrooms. The air conditioning was very effective and we always felt cool. We had villa 117 and it was very quiet.

The location was great - you didn't realise you were so close to an extremely busy road and there were lots of restaurants, shops and services (incl post office and Bintang supermarket) nearby. All of the villas had doorways off a central pathway. This was pretty with nice plants and flowers.
The staff were always pleasant and friendly.

We enjoyed the breakfast, particularly that the chef made pancakes and omelettes fresh at your request. On our first morning our daughter was disappointed that there was no maple syrup for the pancakes, and they made sure that it was there the next day.

We ate at several lovely restaurants - Ultimo (Italian), Mannekepis (Belgian), and Seaside. Also some good cheaper options were Seminyak Cafe and Warang Ocha. We realised that a great way to get to dinner (especially with young kids) is to save yourself the walk, and get a taxi (very cheap) and then you can travel further afield to eat.

A few small points - We found that upon closer inspection, the rooms could have been cleaned slightly better, particularly in the corners. Our shower did not drain quickly, but did eventually drain away.
Overall the rooms suited us well and we enjoyed our stay.
Nice place and great villas, Stayed here for 2 weeks and was very impressed few issues that I will go into later.
The Seminyak suite is located 4 doors up from Bintang Supermarket down a drive way of around 80 meters.
They have alot of villas in the complex lining a pathway that goes straight down the middle of the property with villas doors on left and right.
On checkin we were given villa 9. This was not the best villa as living room wass very small and copped the afternoon sum making it very hot.
Alo the space to get bags into room around pool was only about 1 meter wide making it easy to fall into pool if your not very fit.

After 1 day in this room we discovered a worksite on the other side of bedroom walls from property been built next door. They were chiseling something concrete making our serene relaxing atmosphere impossible.
I asked reception if we could change villa due to noise but told nothing else would be available till that night.
At 8pm we were moved into villa 114.
This was a much nicer villa with larger lounge room/kitchen and pool and away from the noise as was on the left side of complex.
Bathroom and excessively huge and bedrooms are very comfortable.
After 1 week we had to check out and re checkin 4 days later.
For our new villa we were given villa 1- even after I especially asked not to be given villas near building site next door or at the front.

Why not at the front you ask.... The man that shares entry to property has a massive house complex right next to there carpark and lobby and all you can hear all day is roosters crowing. He breeds roosters and a few times I could see with the gate open over 80 baskets all with roosters in them. They start at around 4am and dont sop till around 11pm.
The front villas can hear all this very easily so make sure you ask for a villa back a little from the rooster house.
They then moved us to the 1bdr villa 118 that was very nice and quite.
We also used their Lagoon Spa treatments. were a little overpriced and were good but not great.
PROBLEMS: Now to some of the small issues I had here.
TV is on very weird angle in bedroom. 90 degrees to bed and very hard to watch. Why the didnt put on a pivoting bracket I have no idea.
Also Tv reception was horrible in all 3 villas we stayed in Very snowy signal and also very few channels.
They shrunk a load of our laundry.
We put a load to be washed about 20 items 1 day later it all came back around 4 sizes smaller.
On complaining to front desk all I was offered was a sorry and 50% of the laundry price.
I was shocked and very annoyed but they didnt seem to really care.
Early wake ups from staff.
We started to even put the Do Not Disturb sign up on the door but this never seemed to stop them
Someone would come a ringing at around 7am yelling house keeping. and walk on into villa. To me in my underwear saying go away please comeback later- half asleep.
This happened on around 8 mornings and became very frustrating.
Repair men.
On around 5 of the mornings they proceeded to get locks fixed to the entry doors to villa.
This was a man starting at 6:45am with a chisel and hammer banging on doors to remove wood to fit new lock. each door would take around 1 hr.
Why they chose early morning to start this job is beyond me and became very annoying.
Overall nice villas but service and staff needs to be improved.

Not sure where all the bad reviews are coming from, perhaps a case of mistaken identity? The rooms were huge, kept clean, and air-conditioned. The private pool was fantastic, noise wasn't an issue, the staff were fantastic and super-polite. It really left a lot of comparable properties in Australia behind in terms of overall quality. Will definitely be staying again. The only complaint is the breakfast could be a bit fresher, but hey, rice and eggs are a good start to the day!

We had booked 10 nights at The Sanur Beach Hotel and cancelled our booking after 5 nights as the hotel was 90% full so it was difficult to get a sunbed or a table for breakfast. We went on to last minute deals and booked The Seminyak Suites and loved every minute of our stay. We had our own private pool, sun beds and privacy. Breakfast was okay and only eat there was it was included in the price. Hired a scooter as it was a great way to get into Legian for dinner each night. Overall a lovely place to stay as we got a great deal.

We stayed at the Seminyak Suites for 8 days with our 4 adult/teenage chidren. Whilst the rooms were amazing, the facilities exceeded our expectations, what topped it off for us were the staff. Whilst we were there our entire family came down with a severe case of food poisoning (NEVER EVER eat at the Queens Tandoor!) and the staff could not do enough to help us. This included at 2am getting us more toliet paper water and etc, finding us a doctor, sending over pots of green tea (at no charge), doing additional cleaning of the rooms and geneally being extraordinarily concerned for our welfare and doing what ever they could to make things eaier for us. This wonderful service extended to the everyday little things hotels do - book cars, room service etc - but the service here is way and above what we were expecting.
The rooms were amazing, the location excellent and overall you would have to be mad to stay anywhere else. We will all be back again
175.title: “The perfect place to stay - servce and rooms are amazing”

description: First of all this is the first review I’ve decided to write in my life.
I do this because I feel deeply unsatisfied with the quality of everything the hotel can provide. The Seminyak Suite can be used as perfect example of bad hotel management.
It is really a pity, because it has a potential.
The matter is not the terrible smell in the bathroom or grey bad linens (as well as towels), but in overall management attitude.

The hotel has no one cozy corner to sit and relax. The most attractive place on the territory is occupied by «the office of the hotel», while there is no any notice on the entrance (only staff entrance). There is no privacy, no atmosphere, no soul. We spent 100$ for 1 night and felt like were cheated.

We feel pity to the local personnel. They really tried hard, but all of them are so terrified by the management. Overall hotel needs investment, service, but not just collecting money from the quests.
Last, but not least we are not spoiled by luxury at all, but really it is better to book something else.

This is my second time here in 6 months. I would go back again tomorrow. Its clean modern spacious and the gardens and settings are truely wonderful. Some of the room fittings are a little tired although the private pool and living areas and oversized bed more than make up for the slightest indiscretions. It is a private villa. Great service with regular housekeeping and perfect location to great restaurants and beaches or just stay in and enjoy the privacy of your own personal space.
The only downside is the breakfast which is usually included in the rate.
My advice? Sleep in!! And go somewhere outside for breakfast. Its terrible!! Actually terrible would be a compliment.
Great accommodation. Extremely disappointing breakfast.
I would reccommend purely for everything other than food.

We loved the private feel to our villa. It was great to shut the door and just relax by the pool, knowing you would not be disturbed. The rooms were huge and the service was great. The Staff were friendly and helpful and service was excellent. The location was excellent with shopping very close. We also enjoyed a wonderful morning at the sister spa suites relaxing with a massage and treatments that were tops.

On the negative side, the bathroom was dated and had a slightly 'tacky' feel to it, however the villa was kept spotless with all linen changed daily. The food also was just average but again we could not fault the service.
We would certainly visit again.

We stayed at Seminyak Suite in August 2010. We left our trip planning until the last minute and were devastated that we were not able to get into Kembali Villas or any of the others located a bit further north.

So we booked the Seminyak Suite due to lack of choice. I must say I was a bit concerned by some of the reviews on here. It suited us just fine, the room was huge and the facilities were fine. We spent our time playing music, lounging by the pool and going out shopping. It's location is in between Kuta and Seminyak, so i guess it's a bit in between the two - you need to get a cab to either. I'm not someone who would ever go to Kuta, so my preference would be to be further north near Seminyak closer to Ku De Ta and all the deisgner shops!
All we wanted was something basic, with a good pool and it met our needs...I guess we had low expectations though.
My criticisms are that there needs to be more lounge chairs by the pool, so everyone can have one. The breakfast is awful (as with most places in Asia) and location is average.
Positive points: Pool is great, room is large and really private and very 'no frills'. There are lots of shops just outside the door and good places to eat like SIP directly opposite.
Try to get a good price on this place and it's probably worth it.

Having decided to go to Bali on a 10 day holiday, just my husband and i and having been told that Seminyak is "the place to stay" for exclusive eateries & shopping. We decided to book a Villa with our own pool and a good restaurant so as we could pretty much relax from the outside world and only go out to eat and shop if we really wanted to.

There for we were VERY disappointed with the run down state of this hotel. The staff speak good English and were very helpful, as Balinese always are. However for a Hotel that is only 5 years old we could not belive the state of the Villa, it has old style TV's very hard beds, old kitchen & fridge facilities & the breakfast & food from the room service was not of 5 start quality. The front gate was hard to lock and one night we had to call staff to remove the lock entirely so as we could enter the Villa. The DVD machine hard to operate with no instructions, the bathroom lighting poor, the shower did not drain away so you stood in 4 inches of your shower water as you showered. The towels are old & frayed & the toilet leaked constantly.The street:Jl Raya Seminyak has very few cafe style restaurants, but does have a French, Greek & Thai restaurant in walking distance. Also we can recommend the Rio Bar & Grill - Has great food. However there is only one small market for shopping the rest are up-market shops. And there aren't many of them either.Overall a disappointing stay. Not worth anything like the $350US a night paid. Have stayed in much cheaper and better hotels.
180.title: “Not the 5Star Hotel We expected”

description: Our first night on a late arrival we were greeted by a very tired staff member. Shown to our Villa we immediately had the feeling something was not quite right.. We heard water gushing and a buzzing sound at the back ...and on inspection my husband who is an engineer noticed that the hot water heater was leaking (massively) and probably had been for a month which determined the green slime and smell and bugs that surrounded the back of our bedroom My husband was up until 2.30am helping to assist . Added to this we did not sleep in the bed due to its disgusting sheets

Envision in your mind dryed blood stained beach towels, soiled bath towels, dirty sheets, old and moulding lounge cushions, filthy pots and pans, urine soaked tiles in toilet area, foul cutting board , bug invested toaster, unclean fridge, polluted and leaking hot water heater area…this is what you will get when you book into the Seminyak Suites The list goes on and on …all this is supported by the photographs that were taken prior to our leaving this villa in disgust on our first sleepless night in beautiful Bali.

Added to this when we requested (many times) a refund the owner of the villas (whom by the way was not available) offered 50% off our 12 day stay (some $1400 australian for us to pay for one of the worst nights we have ever experienced in our many times visiting Bal….. final offer was a three night charge ...again highly disappointed as even the embarrassed staff agreed that the villa operations were in a poor state. They did offer an upgrade ...however in our minds if the state of the villas were this bad IMAGINE what their cooking and cleaning situation would be...the thought could not leave us

We managed to find another villa (which took all day) that the management could not believe our experience and went out of their way to accomodate us...we had lost a full two days of our stay in Bali due to Seminyak Suite...
We are happy to with any further enquiries that you may have regarding the seminyak suite please contact us via return email. saltpb@bigpond.com
DO YOURSELF A FAVOUR AND STAY RIGHT AWAY THERE ARE SO MANY OTHER BEAUTIFUL CLEAN VILLAS IN BALI

how disappointing this venue is, has so much potential....BUT! this is supposed to be a timeshare, so why don't the owners put some interest and money in the complex and maintain, don;t they care about their investment...goodness needs paint, bathrooms cleaning, staff nice though.
Since my travel package comes with a few choices,
For this level of budget, this place do provide more than expected space as a whole and a swim-able pool size.
Though, from all the comments learnt in tripadvisor, and the hotel website.
I did have an impression this hotel need to touch up work to be done.
but until i open my door, it was disappointed, the garden and pool are good,
the suite itself,
well, i thought it's 20 years old. actually a little touch up in painting can do the job.
but the owner chose not to, as the whole interior is white centric, it's a simple job.
another disappointment, I got a tiny little traditional TV instead a flat panel as i saw the description in the website. also you can't watch TV directly from bed.
the worst part is the bathroom, it's nice to have a big tub and shower area seperately, but the dirt on tub, dare to try??
hotel location, good, located on main street, and close to supermarket.
a little drawback, though it is located near the beach (as u can the bungee jump tower)
but no direct way to access.
staff are, friendly and full of warm smile, so it made the stay was still pleasant apart from the room quality.
when check out, BIG surprise,
I was charged for a plug adapter, kinda shock, coz no one even say a word about the fee
though it's only IDR 6,000.

If you want to experience third world accommodation then this is the place for you! Our stay was based on the reviews on this forum which looked ok?. We should have known this when we arrived as people were checking out to move to other hotels. Most of the electrical equipment was either broken or not working altogether. The bed linen was soiled and looked like it had been washed with the local soccer teams football boots, the rooms smelt of urine. The compound was like being in a jail, the odd painting or pot plant would not go astray, and a little paint to cover up the leaking roof is not how you fix it!. I never go the the trouble of writing comments in these reviews but feel that If I can save one other family of making the same mistake as I have with my family then have not wasted my time.
